translation:
adv. 在一定程度上; 部分地; 不完全地; 半

分布：部分地(44%)，在一定程度上(31%)，不完全地(25%)


ad.部分地,不完全地,在一定程度上Apart from that apartment, the departed department leader was partly partial to this one.除了那套公寓外,已故系领导还有点偏爱这一套.



US ['pɑ:rt-] adverb  ESSENTIAL  ■to some extent, but not completely 某种程度上
•His attractiveness is partly due to his self-confidence.他的魅力部分源于他的自信。

•The house is partly owned by her father.她父亲拥有这幢房子的部分产权。




adv. 部分地；在一定程度上
 - half
examples: 英 ['pɑːtli] 美 ['pɑːrtli]
adv.在一定程度上；部分地；不完全地

(1) You have introduced a partly random component.(2) The transformation is partly due to demographics.(3) Their energy is partly dissipated.(4) This partly accounts for the efficiency of the company.
(1) 你介绍了一个在一定程度上属于偶然的成分。(2) 这一变化一定程度上是源于人口的变化。(3) 它们的能量被部分地消耗掉。(4) 这部分地说明了公司效率高的原因。
[sound:youdao-9f5884b2-121090b8-e9c52822-6cdb5b2c-f2b2cd7a.mp3]

translation:
n. 伙伴; 同伙; 同伴; 配偶
vt. 使合作; 与…合伙
vi. 合伙; 合股; 成为搭档

时态：partnered, partnering, partners
分布：伙伴(50%)，伴侣(22%)，合伙人(14%)，搭档(13%)，同 ... 合作(1%)


→来自part,部分，-er,人。即成为其中的一部分，引申词义伙伴，伴侣。
合作伙伴(part+ner人)[part,port=part,divide,表示"部分,分开"]
n.合作者,合伙人,合股人,伙伴,舞伴,配偶The Particle party's partner participated in the particular Parliament.粒子党的合伙人参与了特别议会.



US ['pɑ:rt.nɚ] noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a person or organization you are closely involved with in some way 搭档，伙伴，同伴
•He gave up his job as a police officer after his partner was killed.他在搭档被杀后辞去了警官的工作。

•The two companies are partners in a contract to build a new power station.这两家公司订立合约，共同建造一座新的发电厂。
 ADVANCED  ■one of the owners of a company （公司的）合伙人
•He's a partner in an insurance company/a law firm.他是一家保险公司／律师事务所的合伙人。
 ADVANCED  ■the person you are married to or living with as if you were married to them, or the person you are having a sexual relationship with 配偶；情人；性伴侣■one of a pair of dancers or one of a pair who are playing a sport or a game together, especially when the pair are playing as a team 舞伴
UK ['pɑ:t.nər] US ['pɑ:rt.nɚ] verb transitive ■If you partner someone in a sport, a game or a dance, you act as their partner. （在体育运动、游戏或舞蹈中）与（某人）合作，与（某人）成为搭档




comrade, companion, colleague, partner, fellow, associate

这组词都有“同事，伙伴”的意思，其区别是：
comrade: 指具有共同的事业、利益关系相一致的人。
companion: 指陪伴他人的人，即同伴或陪伴。
colleague: 一般用于对同事的正式称呼，基本上专用在职业关系上。
partner: 指事业中处于合伙关系的人，或指婚姻、游戏、跳舞中的另一方。
fellow: 多用复数形式，指一块住、生活或同行共事的人。
associate: 普通用词，侧重指在利害关系上密切相关。


n. 伙伴； [法] 合伙人；配偶
 - comrade, associate
vi. [法] 合伙；合股；成为搭档
 - joint stock, tie up
vt. 使合作；与…合伙
 - team
examples: 英 ['pɑːtnə(r)] 美 ['pɑːrtnər]
n.伙伴；搭档；伴侣；合伙人v.同 ... 合作；做 ... 的搭档

(1) He has a competent partner who always organizes everything well for him.(2) Will you be my partner in the next dance?(3) I am so lucky to have a partner like you to enjoy the beauty of life together.(4) Her partner tried to trick her out of her share.(5) They have to partner with the government, even if they are dismissive of its bureaucracy.(6) Gerry offered to partner me at tennis.
(1) 他有个很能干的伙伴,总是替他把一切弄得井井有条。(2) 下一支曲子时可否请你跟我一起跳舞?(3) 我真幸运,能拥有你这样的伴侣陪我一起享受生命中的美好。(4) 她的合伙人企图骗走她的股份。(5) 他们同政府合作,即使他们看不惯政府的官僚主义。(6) 格里提出和我一起搭档打网球。

translation:
n. （文章的）一段; 经过; 通路，通道; 旅程，行程

分布：通道(45%)，通过(38%)，走廊(17%)


→来自pass,走过，通过。
通过,通行(pass+age)[pass=passthrough表示"通过"]
n.通过,经过;通路,走廊;(一)段落,(一)节In the passage the passenger passed a cassette of message to messenger.在过道里,乘客给信差传递了一盒带信息.



noun CONNECTING WAY  通道   ADVANCED  countable (also passageway) ■a usually long and narrow part of a building with rooms on one or both sides, or a covered path which connects places 过道，走廊
•A narrow passage led directly through the house into the garden.一条狭窄的通道直接从房子通向花园。

•The bathroom's on the right at the end of the passage.浴室在走廊尽头的右边。
countable ■a hollow part of the body through which something goes （体内的）管道，通道
•the nasal passages鼻腔

•the anal passage肛门通道；肛道

['pæs.ɪdʒ] noun PART  部分   ADVANCED  countable ■a short piece of writing or music which is part of a larger piece of work （文章的）段落；（音乐的）乐节
•Several passages from the book were printed in a national newspaper before it was published.该书出版前，书中有几段文字被刊载在一份全国性的报纸上。

['pæs.ɪdʒ] noun TRAVEL  旅行  uncountable formal ■travel, especially as a way of escape 旅行；（尤指）转移
•The gunman then took a hostage and demanded a plane and safe passage to an unspecified destination.持枪歹徒随后劫持了一名人质，要求派飞机把他安全送到某个未指明的目的地。
only singular old-fashioned ■a journey, especially over the sea （尤指海上的）旅程，航程
•He had booked his passage to Rio de Janeiro.他订了去里约热内卢的船票。
work your passage old-fashioned ■to do work on a ship during your journey instead of paying for a ticket 在船上做工以抵偿船费
['pæs.ɪdʒ] noun MOVEMENT  移动  uncountable ■an act of moving through somewhere 通过，穿过
•Many meteors disintegrate during their passage through the atmosphere.许多流星在穿越大气层时会分解。

•The government prohibits the passage of foreign troops and planes across its territory.该政府禁止外国军队和飞机穿越其领土和领空。

['pæs.ɪdʒ] noun TIME  时间  the passage of time literary■the action of time going past 时间的流逝
•Memories fade with the passage of time.随着时间的流逝，记忆会慢慢褪去。

['pæs.ɪdʒ] noun LAW  法律  uncountable formal ■the official approval of something, especially a new law （尤指新法律的）通过
•He again urged passage of a constitutional amendment outlawing abortion.他再次敦促通过一项宪法修正案，把人工流产定为非法。




n. 一段（文章）；走廊；通路
 - hall, opening, access, corridor
examples: 英 ['pæsɪdʒ] 美 ['pæsɪdʒ]
n.通过；通道；走廊；(文章等的)段落；(时间的)消逝

(1) The bridge is not strong enough to allow the passage of vehicles.(2) The police kept a clear passage for the traffic.(3) We discovered a secret passage behind the wall.(4) This is our room, and yours is down the passage.(5) This passage may be given several interpretations.(6) He's had a rough passage since his son's death, with one illness after another.
(1) 这座桥不够牢固，车辆不能通行。(2) 警方使来往车辆畅通无阻。(3) 我们在墙后发现了一个秘密通道。(4) 这是我们的房间，你们的在走廊的那一头。(5) 这段文字可以有不同的解释。(6) 自打他儿子死后他的日子过得很艰苦，病了一场又一场。
[sound:youdao-e78fbb8e-56421792-37f8aa78-239ceac0-77a49b07.mp3]

translation:
n. 乘客，旅客; 行人，过路人; 碍手碍脚的人

分布：乘客(66%)，旅客(34%)


→来自法语passer,走过，经过，-enger,人，词源同messenger.引申词义旅客，乘客。
乘客,旅客(pass+enger人→通过的人→乘客)[pass=passthrough表示"通过"]
n.乘客,旅客In the passage the passenger passed a cassette of message to messenger.在过道里,乘客给信差传递了一盒带信息.



US [-dʒɚ] noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a person who is travelling in a vehicle but is not driving it, flying it or working on it 乘客，旅客
•airline/rail/train/car passengers飞机／火车／汽车乘客
passenger train ■a train carrying people rather than goods 客运火车
•The two passenger trains involved in the accident had both come from south-west London.这次意外中的两列客运火车都是从伦敦西南部开出的。





passenger, client, guest, customer, visitor

这组词都有“客人，访问者”的意思，其区别是：
passenger: 主要指乘坐交通工具的游人或旅客。
client: 与customer同义，多指进入商店被店员接待或购物的人。
guest: 多指事先受到激请而来，并受到欢迎与招待的宾客。也可指付钱居住者。
customer: 主要指交易一方的买主、主顾。
visitor: 普通用词，指出差、访问、旅游、参观或到旅馆投宿的人。


n. 旅客； [交] 乘客；过路人；碍手碍脚的人
 - traveler, viator
examples: 英 ['pæsɪndʒə(r)] 美 ['pæsɪndʒər]
n.乘客；旅客
(1) The mysterious woman passenger vanished.(2) The passenger berthed beside me.(3) The allowance per passenger is 25 kg.(4) Passenger traffic has gone up by 20 per cent.
(1) 这位神秘的女乘客突然不见了。(2) 这名乘客的铺位在我的旁边。(3) 每个旅客的行李重量限25公斤。(4) 客流量已增长百分之二十。
[sound:youdao-c223dd58-7d6e1b1d-20692635-0b71239b-e17abe2d.mp3]

translation:
n. 激情，热情; 热心，爱好; 热恋; 酷爱
vt. &vi. [诗歌用语]表露强烈感情，显示巨大热情

分布：激情(59%)，热情(35%)，酷爱(4%)，盛怒(2%)


→来自拉丁语pati,忍受，承受，来自pei,伤害，词源同fiend.-ss,过去分词格。该词原指耶稣被钉在十字架上身体所遭受的痛苦，后引申词义强烈感情，激情，渴望等。
激情(pass+ion)[pass=felling表示"感情"]
n.热情,激情,爱好;激怒;强烈感情In the past the compass could pass passion to the passive man having pastime on the pasture.在过去,指南针可以将激情传递给在牧场上消遣的被动之人



noun countable or uncountable  IMPROVER  ■a very powerful feeling, for example of sexual attraction , love, hate, anger or other emotion 激情，热情；强烈情感
•Football arouses a good deal of passion among its supporters.足球唤起了球迷巨大的热情。

•At school, his early interest in music developed into an abiding passion.他早年对音乐萌生的兴趣在求学时期发展成一种始终不渝的热爱。

•Politics and philosophy were his lifelong passions.政治学和哲学是他毕生热爱的学科。
a passion for sth ■an extreme interest in or wish for doing something, such as a hobby, activity, etc 对…的热爱，对…的强烈爱好
•Anton has a consuming passion for science fiction.安东对科幻小说痴迷不已。
passions [plural] ■very powerful feelings 强烈的情感
•Touch a man's property and his passions are immediately aroused.任何人要是被动了财物，那他会立刻变得异常激愤。

['pæʃ.ən] noun countable or uncountable passions run high ■a way of describing a time when people feel strong emotions about a particular subject 激情高涨
•Passions run very high at election time.大选期间民众热情高涨。





sentiment, sensation, feeling, passion, emotion

这组词都有“感情”的意思，其区别是：
sentiment: n.思想感情，情绪，感情色彩，指由于某种思想唤起的感情，强调主观作用，有时候也带有理智成分。
 • When our grandmother died, we remembered her life with strong sentiment.   当祖母逝世时，我们深深地怀念她的一生。
sensation: n.指人体感官受到外部刺激时产生的感觉，知觉。
 • When she watched the film, she had the sensation that she was in a moving car.   她看电影时，感觉自己正坐在一辆开动的汽车上。
feeling: n.指一般的情绪、感觉，它一般不反映感情的本质和强度。
passion: n.激情，热情，欲望，极度的仇恨，指强烈的爱好、愤怒或情欲。
 • He spoke with passion about the love of freedom.   他满腔热情地谈论着对自由的热爱。
emotion: n.情感，感情，指喜怒哀乐等较激动的情绪，表示某物引起的激动。
 • He felt mixed emotions when he thought of her.   当他想起她时便产生一种复杂的感情。



sentiment, affection, feeling, passion, emotion

这组词都有“感情”的意思，其区别是：
sentiment: 一般指由一种思想激起的感情，含较大的理智因素。
affection: 指对人的爱慕或深厚、温柔的感情。
feeling: 普通用词，含义广。多指具体的或内心的感受，或表露出来的强烈情感。
passion: 指极强烈的感情、尤指愤怒、爱好等。也常指两性间的爱情。
emotion: 普通用词，词义中性。泛指因外界刺激而引起思想情感从细微变化到最强烈的发作。


n. 激情；热情；酷爱；盛怒
 - flame, love, fire, warmth
examples: 英 ['pæʃn] 美 ['pæʃn]
n.激情；热情；酷爱；盛怒
(1) The dying embers of the former passion can still be seen in his articles.(2) I have a passion for American literature.(3) His passion for reading never deserted him.
(1) 往日激情将熄的余烬仍可从他的文中章看出来。(2) 我酷爱美国文学。(3) 他从未放弃过对读书的热爱。

translation:
adj. 被动的; 消极的; 不抵抗的; 冷漠的
n. 动词被动形式，被动语态

分布：被动的(65%)，消极的(29%)，被动性(6%)


→来自拉丁语pati,忍受，承受，词源同passion.即承受的，引申词义被动的，消极的。
消极的,被动的(pass+ive→感情用事→被动的)[pass=felling表示"感情"]
a.被动的,消极的In the past the compass could pass passion to the passive man having pastime on the pasture.在过去,指南针可以将激情传递给在牧场上消遣的被动之人



adjective BEHAVIOUR  行为  often disapproving ■not acting to influence or change a situation; allowing other people to be in control 被动的，消极的；顺从的
•He's very passive in the relationship.他在这段关系中非常被动。

•Men have always played an active part in leading worship while women have been confined to more passive roles.男性在宗教崇拜方面一直起着主导作用，而女性则一直被局限于较被动的角色。
⇒ See also impassive
['pæs.ɪv] adjective GRAMMAR  文法  specialized■of the form of a verb used when the grammatical subject is the person or thing which experiences the effect of an action, rather than the person or thing which causes the effect 被动语态的
•'He was released from prison' is a passive sentence.He was released from prison 是个被动句。

['pæs.ɪv] noun only singular specialized the passive  IMPROVER  ■a way of structuring a sentence so that the grammatical subject is the person or thing which experiences the effect of an action, rather than the person or thing which causes the effect 被动语态
•When changed into the passive, 'The dog chased the cat' becomes 'The cat was chased by the dog'.The dog chased the cat 变成被动句后，为 The cat was chased by the dog.
 Compare active



adj. 被动的，消极的；被动语态的
 - driven, negative
examples: 英 ['pæsɪv] 美 ['pæsɪv]
adj.被动的；消极的n.被动性

(1) He played a passive role in the marriage.(2) You are passive when you allow things to happen, but do nothing.(3) Good is the passive that obeys reason.(4) Passive tear suctioning force can be demonstrated by a Venturi tube model.
(1) 他在婚姻中扮演了一个被动的角色。(2) 当你让这些事发生,而不做任何事来阻止它,你是消极的。(3) 善是服从理智的被动性。(4) 被动性泪液吸引之力量，可藉由文氏管模型来解释。
[sound:youdao-8d1acfef-cb7cb9dc-52565fe6-d28a591e-b921b4ee.mp3]

translation:
n. 护照，通行证; 手段

分布：护照(97%)，手段(3%)


→pass,通过，port,港口，关口。即通关凭证。
护照(pass+port港口→通过港口的凭证→护照)[pass=passthrough表示"通过"]
n.护照,达到某种目的的手段On the porter's passport a portion of the portrait isn't proportional.在搬运工的护照上,部分肖像不成比例.



US ['pæs.pɔ:rt] noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■an official document containing personal information and usually a photograph which allows a person to travel to foreign countries and to prove who they are 护照
•Many refugees have arrived at the border without passports.许多难民到达边境时身上没有护照。

•He was a German, travelling on a Swiss passport.他是个德国人，持瑞士护照旅行。

•passport control (= the examining of travellers' passports)护照检查

•a passport photo护照照片
a passport to sth ■a certain way of getting something you want 获取…的手段
•Many students opt for business studies simply because it sounds like a passport to a good job.许多学生选择学商，只因它似乎是找到好工作的一种手段。

•Beauty alone can be a passport to success.人们单凭美貌也可能获得成功。




n. [法] 护照，通行证；手段
 - protection, instrument, shift, road, tool
examples: 英 ['pɑːspɔːt] 美 ['pæspɔːrt]
n.护照；手段
(1) Show me your passport, please.(2) My passport has been transacted.(3) He views boxing as his passport out of poverty.(4) He thought that money was a passport to high society.
(1) 请出示护照。(2) 我的护照已经办完了。(3) 他把拳击看作自己摆脱贫困的手段。(4) 他以为金钱是通往上流社会的手段。
[sound:youdao-fc01e9cd-392bf9dd-57753620-33c16ccc-98988442.mp3]

translation:
n. 面团; 糨糊; 肉（或鱼等）酱（作涂抹料或烹饪用）; （制作人造宝石的）铅质玻璃
vt. 粘贴，张贴; 以…覆盖于

时态：pasted, pasting, pastes
分布：粘贴(53%)，糊(26%)，浆糊(10%)，面团(5%)，糊状物(4%)，裱糊(2%)


→来自拉丁语pasta,面团，面食。引申词义面糊，胶体，胶状物，粘贴等。
n.糊,浆糊v.粘,贴I tasted the paste in haste and cast it on the waste plaster.我匆忙品尝了浆糊然后将其丢在废泥灰上.



noun uncountable STICKY SUBSTANCE  黏性物质  ■a thick soft sticky substance made by mixing a liquid with a powder, especially to make a type of glue 糊；面团；（尤指）浆糊
•flour-and-water paste面粉与水和成的面团

•wallpaper paste贴壁纸用的浆糊
■a thick soft substance made by crushing and mixing things such as fish, fruit or vegetables for food 酱
•tomato/anchovy/curry paste番茄／鳀鱼／咖喱酱

[peɪst] noun uncountable HARD MATERIAL  坚硬的材料  specialized■a hard type of glass used to make artificial jewels （制人造宝石用的）铅质玻璃
•Are these real diamonds or paste?这些是真钻石还是人造宝石？

[peɪst] verb STICK  黏  transitive usually + adverb or preposition ■to stick something to something, especially with paste （尤指用浆糊）黏，贴
•You can make your own distorting mirror by pasting a sheet of kitchen foil to a piece of thin cardboard.你可以将一张厨房用铝箔纸贴在一块薄纸板上自己做一个哈哈镜。

[peɪst] verb COMPUTING  电脑操作  intransitive or transitive ■to move a piece of text to a particular place in a computer document （在电脑档案中）黏贴（某段文字）
•Cut that paragraph and then paste it at the end of the page.将那一段剪下来，贴到页尾上。




vt. 张贴，裱糊；用浆糊粘
 - post
n. 面团，膏；糊状物， [胶粘] 浆糊
 - mash
examples: 英 [peɪst] 美 [peɪst]
n.面团；浆糊；糊状物；糊vt.裱糊；粘贴

(1) The boy squeezed paste into a ball .(2) We used paste to attach our designs to the poster.(3) Stir the flour and milk to a stiff paste.(4) Would you like some tomato paste?(5) She pasted the pictures into a scrapbook.(6) It's quicker to cut and paste than to retype.(7) Please paste these sheets of paper together.
(1) 孩子把面团捏成了球形。(2) 我们用浆糊把我们设计的图案贴在招贴牌上。(3) 把面粉和牛奶搅成很稠的糊。(4) 你要西红柿酱吗？(5) 她把图片贴在剪贴簿上。(6) 剪切和粘贴比重新打字要快。(7) 请将这几张纸粘在一起。
[sound:youdao-5095a786-dfa29a1d-601bb6f0-5af70745-f008e944.mp3]

translation:
n. 消遣，娱乐

分布：消遣(73%)，娱乐(27%)


→缩写自pass time.
n.消遣,娱乐In the past the compass could pass passion to the passive man having pastime on the pasture.在过去,指南针可以将激情传递给在牧场上消遣的被动之人



US ['pæs-] noun countable ■an activity which is done for enjoyment; a hobby 消遣，娱乐
•Do-it-yourself is the nation's most popular pastime.自己动手是该国最流行的消遣活动。

•figurative Suing people, especially doctors, is a national pastime (= common activity) in America.在美国，提出诉讼——尤其是控告医生——是一种全民热衷的寻常事。





hoblly, pastime, recreation

这组词都有“嗜好，消遣，娱乐”的意思，其区别是：
hoblly: 指在某一具有知识性和趣味性的领域内从事的业余爱好活动。
pastime: 多指消遣，系空余时间的娱乐活动，常常不具什么内在价值或意义。
recreation: 通常指令人愉快的消遣或有节制的活动，侧重于游玩、游戏和消遣。


n. 娱乐，消遣
 - entertainment, recreation, pleasure, sport, occupation
examples: 英 ['pɑːstaɪm] 美 ['pæstaɪm]
n.消遣；娱乐
(1) His favorite pastime is tinkering with old radios.(2) In fact, it's something of a national pastime.
(1) 他最喜欢的消遣就是整修老旧的收音机。(2) 事实上，在某种意义上它是全国人民的娱乐。

translation:
vt. & vi. 轻拍，爱抚; 拍成，拍至
n. 轻拍; 轻拍某物发出的声音; 小团，小块
adj. 恰好的，适当的; 熟练的; 过于巧合的，人为的; 快活的，活泼的
vt. 表扬，称赞（某人/自己）

时态：patted, patting, pats
分布：轻拍(60%)，轻打(15%)，拍打(11%)，小块(10%)，抚摸(4%)


→可能来自拟声词，模仿轻拍的声音。引申词义鼓励，表扬。
v./n.轻拍,轻打,抚摸On the flat platform the bat will pat whatever hat it likes.在平坦的站台上,蝙蝠会拍打它喜欢的任何帽子.



verb transitive (-tt-) ADVANCED  ■to touch someone or something gently and usually repeatedly with the hand flat 轻拍，轻打
•He patted my head/patted me on the head affectionately.他慈爱地拍了拍我的头。

•I bent down to pat the little puppy.我弯腰拍了拍那只小狗。

[pæt] verb transitive (-tt-)pat sb on the back ■to praise someone for doing something good 称赞，赞扬（某人）
[pæt] noun countable TOUCH  触摸  ■when you pat a person or animal 轻拍，轻打
•I gave the little boy a pat on the head.我轻轻地拍了拍小男孩的头。

[pæt] noun countable PIECE  一块  ■a small flat piece, especially of butter （尤指牛油）小块
[pæt] noun countable a pat on the back ■praise 称赞，赞扬
•I got a pat on the back from (= was praised by) my boss.我得到了老板的称赞。

[pæt] adjective usually disapproving ■describes an answer or remark that someone has previously prepared, so that they say it quickly and without any real thought （回答或说话）预先准备好的，脱口而出的
•The minister came out with a pat answer/response.那位部长作出了一个预先准备好的答覆。

[pæt] adjective usually disapproving have/know sth off pat UK (US have/know sth down pat) ■to know something so well that you can say or do it without having to try or think 对…滚瓜烂熟，对…了若指掌
•I'd given the talk so many times I had it off pat.这个讲座我讲的次数太多了，都滚瓜烂熟了。





pat, knock, rap, tap

这组词都有“敲、击”的意思，其区别是：
pat: 指用手轻拍以示同情、赞同或爱抚。
knock: 指用拳头或其它器械猛敲或猛打；也指用手轻敲某物。
rap: 指用手指或木棒等快速地轻敲或急拍。
tap: 多指慢慢地连续地轻击或轻拍。


adj. 恰好的；熟练的；合适的
 - experienced, applicable, skilled, becoming, shaped
adv. 恰好；熟记地
 - just, spot
n. 轻拍；小块；轻拍声
 - tablet, nubble
vt. 轻拍
 - chuck
vi. 轻拍
 - tap
examples: 英 [pæt] 美 [pæt]
n.轻拍；轻打；小块v.轻拍；抚摸；拍打

(1) He gave her a reassuring pat on the shoulder.(2) He gave me a light pat on the shoulder.(3) It was a basket with fresh eggs, a newly-baked loaf of bread, a pat of butter.(4) The mother patted the little girl to make her go to sleep.(5) Snowflakes were patting against the window.
(1) 他轻拍了一下她的肩膀让她放心。(2) 他在我肩上轻轻一拍。(3) 这个篮子里有新鲜鸡蛋，一条新出炉的面包和一小块黄油。(4) 母亲拍小女孩入睡。(5) 雪花轻轻拍打着窗户。
[sound:youdao-8357d9f5-2ef54cf6-ae70d7d5-6aba5847-7fb4e453.mp3]

translation:
n. 补丁，补片; 眼罩; 斑点; 小块
vt. 修补，拼凑; 暂时遮掩一下; 修理，平息（吵架等）; 用美人斑装饰（脸）
vi. 打补丁

时态：patched, patching, patches
分布：补丁(48%)，修补(31%)，眼罩(9%)，解决(9%)，补缀(1%)，小片(1%)，掩饰(1%)


→来自古法语pieche,来自piece方言变体，引申词义小块，斑点，补丁等。插入字母t,比较bake,batch.
n.补丁,斑点,碎片小块v.补,修补,掩饰I scratched a match and saw my watch catching a patch.我划了一根火柴发现我的手表钩着了一块补丁.



noun countable AREA  地区   ADVANCED  ■a small area which is different in some way from the area that surrounds it （与周围不同的）斑，小块
•Our dog has a black patch on his back.我们的狗背上有块黑斑。

•The hotel walls were covered in damp patches.饭店的墙壁上满是湿渍。

•There were lots of icy patches on the road this morning.今天早上路上有多处地方结了冰。

•This story is good in patches (= some parts are good) , but I wouldn't really recommend it.这本小说有些部分写得不错，但我不是很想推荐它。
■informal ■a local area within which someone works 工作地
•He's been working as a policeman on the same patch for twenty years.他已经在同一个管区当了20年的员警。

[pætʃ] noun countable PIECE OF MATERIAL  一块布料  ■a small piece of material fixed over something to cover it 补钉，补片
•I'll have to sew a patch onto these jeans - they're ripped at the knee.我要在这条牛仔裤上缝个补钉——膝盖处撕破了。
■a small piece of material which can be stuck to the skin, from which particular substances can be absorbed into the body 膏药，贴布
•Some people wear nicotine patches to help them give up smoking.有些人贴尼古丁戒烟贴片来帮助自己戒烟。
■* an eye-patch 
[pætʃ] noun countable COMPUTER  电脑  ■a small computer program that can be added to an existing program in order to make the existing program work as it should （用来完善已有程式的）程式补钉，修补程式
•I downloaded a patch from their website.我从他们的网站上下载了一个程式补钉。
 Compare plugin
[pætʃ] noun countable go through a bad/difficult/rough/sticky patch informal ■to experience a lot of problems in a period in your life 倒楣，不走运
•Andy's going through a bit of a rough patch at the moment - his wife wants a divorce.安迪目前处境有点困难——他老婆要跟他离婚。

[pætʃ] noun countable not be a patch on sth UK informal ■to be much less good than something 远比不上，远不如
•This new washing machine isn't a patch on our old one.这台新洗衣机远不如我们那台旧的。

[pætʃ] verb CONNECT  连接  transitive usually + adverb or preposition specialized ■to connect electronic or telephone equipment to a system 接通，连接（电子设备或电话）
[pætʃ] verb PIECE OF MATERIAL  一块布料  transitive ■to put a patch on something 缝补；修补
[pætʃ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] patch sth together ■to arrange something very quickly but not very carefully 仓促拼合，草草拼凑
•There is much disagreement, but the group of countries is trying to patch together a treaty on defence.尽管存在很多分歧，这几个国家还是试图草拟出一份防御条约。

[pætʃ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] patch sth up ■to try to improve a relationship after there have been problems 弥合（关系），和解
•Jackie and Bill are still trying to patch up their marriage.杰基和比尔仍在设法修补他们的婚姻。

•Did you manage to patch things up with Jackie after your row?你们争吵过后，你有没有设法和杰基言归于好？
■to repair something, especially in a basic and temporary way 修理；（尤指）临时草草修补
[pætʃ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   patch sb/sth up ■to give basic medical care to someone that helps them temporarily 为…提供基本（或临时）的治疗，为…草草包扎
•If you've cut your hand, the first aider will patch you up.如果你割破了手，急救员会为你处理的。





fix, mend, repair, patch

这组词都有“修理，修复”的意思，其区别是：
fix: 多用于美语，仅用于指带有安装固定性质的修理。
mend: 通常指较简单的修复过程，一般不需要专门技术或特殊工具。
repair: 可与mend换用，但一般指需要较高的职业技能和使用较复杂的工具进行修理。
patch: 通常指用类似材料修补破洞、裂缝或磨损的地方。


n. 眼罩；斑点；碎片；小块土地
 - spot, chip, debris
vt. 修补；解决；掩饰
 - decide, settle
examples: 英 [pætʃ] 美 [pætʃ]
n.小片；补丁；眼罩；（贴在伤口的）膏药；【生态】斑块vt.修补；补缀；解决；掩饰

(1) The ground is wet in patches.(2) He reset a patch of land with tomato plants.(3) She sewed a patch onto the knee of the trousers.(4) He would indeed seek to patch things up.(5) Can you patch up this electric iron?(6) Do you know how to patch an inner tube?(7) He patched up a couple of old tires.
(1) 地上湿处片片。(2) 他在一小块地上重新种上番茄。(3) 她在裤子的膝部打了个补丁.(4) 他一定会设法把事情加以补救。(5) 你能将这只电熨斗修理一下吗?(6) 你知道怎样修补内管吗?(7) 他补了几条旧车胎。
[sound:youdao-63b7d424-3bf095f9-82bafb6d-e9b85195-b6802d47.mp3]

translation:
n. 小路，路; 路线，路程; 〈比喻〉（人生的）道路; （思想，行为，生活的）途径

分布：小路(50%)，小径(25%)，路线(13%)，轨道(8%)，路程(4%)


→来自古英语path,小路，小径，来自Proto-Germanic*pathaz,来自pent,走，经过，踩踏，词源同find,pons.可能进一步来自pete,展开，来自ped,脚，词源同foot,pedestal.
n.小路,小径;路线,轨道There is a small rugged path through the fields.田野里有条崎岖小路.



US [pæθ] noun countable TRACK  小径   IMPROVER  ■a route or track between one place and another, or the direction in which something is moving 路，小道，小径
•a garden path花园小路

•a concrete path水泥路

•a well-trodden path经常有人走的小路

•This is the path to the cliffs.这条路通向悬崖。

•It will be several days before snowploughs clear a path (through) to the village.要过几天铲雪机才能清出一条通向该村的小路。

•They followed the path until they came to a gate.他们沿着这条路走到了一个大门口。

•A fierce fire is still raging through the forest, burning everything in its path (= as it moves forward).烈火仍在森林中肆虐，将沿途的一切都化为灰烬。

•The Weather Service issues warnings to people in the path of a hurricane (= in the area in which it is moving).国家气象局向身处飓风路径地区的人们发出警告。

•The charged particles move in spiral paths.带电粒子呈螺旋状运动。

•figurative His path through life was never easy.他的人生之路一直不平坦。

UK [pɑ:θ] US [pæθ] noun countable ACTIONS  一系列行动   ADVANCED  ■a set of actions, especially ones which lead to a goal or result （尤指达到某一目的或结果的）行动步骤，途径
•The path to success is fraught with difficulties.成功之路充满艰辛。

UK [pɑ:θ] US [pæθ] noun countable paths cross ■If two people's paths cross, they meet 遇见，相遇
•It was a pleasure meeting you - I hope our paths cross again.很高兴见到你——我希望我们能再次见面。





highway, route, avenue, trail, street, path, motorway, way, road, pavement, lane

这组词都有“路”的意思，其区别是：
highway: 通常指市区外可以通行各种机动车辆的交通干线。
route: 指从此处通往彼处的路线、路程等。
avenue: 在美国，指城市中一侧或两侧建筑物林立的大道或马路；而在英国则常指通住乡村大住宅、私人大庄园或两旁栽树的道路。
trail: 指人或兽在森林、荒野或山中踩出的小径或崎岖小道。
street: 尤指城市中的道路，往往一侧或两侧有高大建筑物；还可指城市小镇、近郊可供人、车、马行走的平坦道路。
path: 多指由人或动物在田间、小丘或树丛中经常走动而踩出的小路，也指公园或花园等供人走的小径。
motorway: 高速公路，新词，特指为车辆快速通行而修的专线，美语为freeway或expressway。
way: 普通用词，含义广泛，可指各种路、道或通道，也可指抽象的道路。
road: 指连接两地间供行人或车辆使用的广阔平坦的大道，多指公路，也可用于引申意义。
pavement: 在英国，多指街道两旁的人行道，而美国人常用sidewlk表示人行道。
lane: 指农村或城镇的小道或小径，也指小巷。


n. 道路；小路； [数] 轨道
 - way, railway, track, road, course
examples: 英 [pɑːθ] 美 [pæθ]
n.路线；小路；小径；轨道；路程

(1) A bullet describes a curved path in the air.(2) We bumped up and down along the gravel path.(3) They went out for a walk on the gravelled path.(4) The moon's path is round the earth.(5) Our path bristles with difficulties.(6) Let me carry the lamp through the stormy path.
(1) 子弹在空中作曲线运动。(2) 我们沿砾石小路颠簸而行。(3) 他们在碎石小径上散步。(4) 月亮绕地球的轨道。(5) 我们的路程困难重重。(6) 走过暴风雨的路程吧。
[sound:youdao-4dcbf544-348c7b4e-0a5d7c7b-9395eebb-9fa57a62.mp3]

translation:
n. 耐心，耐性; 忍耐; 单人纸牌游戏

分布：耐心(83%)，忍耐(13%)，毅力(4%)


→来自拉丁语pati,忍受，承受，词源同passion,passive.即忍受力，忍耐，耐心。
耐心;忍受(par[=pass]+ience→感情,有感情就有耐心→耐心)[pass=felling表示"感情"]
n.耐心,忍耐Have patience!要忍耐!



noun uncountable QUALITY  素质   IMPROVER  ■the ability to wait, or to continue doing something despite difficulties, or to suffer without complaining or becoming annoyed 忍耐，耐心
•You have to have such a lot of patience when you're dealing with kids.和孩子相处需要有这么大的耐心才行。

•In the end I lost my patience and shouted at her.最后我失去了耐性，对她大吼大叫起来。

•He's a good teacher, but he doesn't have much patience with the slower pupils.他是个好老师，但对较迟钝的学生没多大耐心。

•Making small-scale models takes/requires a great deal of patience.做小型模型需要极大的耐心。

•Their youngest son was beginning to try my patience (= annoy me).他们的小儿子开始让我忍无可忍。

•Patience - they'll be here soon!别急——他们马上就到！
 Opposite impatience
['peɪ.ʃənts] noun uncountable CARD GAME  纸牌游戏  UK (US solitaire) ■a game played with cards by one person 单人纸牌游戏
['peɪ.ʃənts] noun uncountable have the patience of a saint ■to always be calm and never allow anything to upset you 有圣人般的耐心；从容淡定
['peɪ.ʃənts] noun uncountable the patience of Job ■the ability to remain patient and to do what you think you should do despite having many problems 极度忍耐，极大耐心




endurance, patience

这组词都有“忍耐，耐心”的意思，其区别是：
endurance: 侧重指忍受艰辛或痛苦的能力。
patience: 普通用词，通常指不急不躁的容忍态度或能力。


n. 耐性，耐心；忍耐，容忍
 - tolerance, endurance
examples: 英 ['peɪʃns] 美 ['peɪʃns]
n.耐心；忍耐；毅力

(1) Her endless patience made her the best nurse in the hospital.(2) His patience was worn out by all these troubles.(3) She owes her success to hard work and patience.(4) His rudeness was beyond my patience.(5) Learning to walk again after his accident required great patience.
(1) 无限的耐心使她成为这个医院最好的护士。(2) 这么多麻烦使他都没有耐心了。(3) 她的成功是努力工作和耐心的结果。(4) 他的粗暴使我无法忍受。(5) 他出事后重新学习走路要有极大的毅力。
[sound:youdao-f118d3e7-fa06b5c9-31fe791a-31955a10-a610487e.mp3]

translation:
adj. 有耐性的; 能容忍的
n. 患者; 病人; 病号

分布：病人(95%)，有耐心的(4%)，能忍耐的(1%)


→来自拉丁语pati,忍受，承受，词源同passion,passive.-ent,现在分词后缀。即正在忍受的，正在遭受痛苦的，引申词义病人。
a.有耐心的,能忍耐的n.病人,患者The mental patient thinks the cement is the elementary element of the ornament.精神病人认为水泥是装饰品的基本成分.



noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a person who is receiving medical care, or who is cared for by a particular doctor or dentist when necessary 病人
•I'm a patient of Dr Stephens, please could I make an appointment to see her?我是史蒂芬斯医生的病人，请问我能不能预约一下看病时间？

['peɪ.ʃənt] adjective  IMPROVER  ■having patience 有耐心的，忍耐的
•Dinner will be ready in half an hour - just be patient!晚餐半小时后就好——耐心点！

•Be patient with her - she's very young.对她耐心点——她年纪还小。
 Opposite impatient




patient, invalid

这组词都有“病人”的意思，其区别是：
patient: 泛指正患病的人，尤指正接受治疗的人。
invalid: 多指因伤病或营养不良而造成键康受损，需要他人照顾、护理的病人，也指先天性的残疾者。


adj. 有耐性的，能容忍的
 - indefatigable
n. [医] 病人；患者
 - sick, sufferer
examples: 英 ['peɪʃnt] 美 ['peɪʃnt]
adj.有耐心的；能忍耐的n.病人

(1) You'll have to be patient with my mother she's going rather deaf.(2) He is a patient man, but not even he could sit down under that kind of provocation.(3) To have access to the good things of the world, one has to be patient and wait.(4) After patient explanations, he carried all the members with him on that proposal.(5) The patient began to gain ground as soon as she had good food.(6) The patient is seriously ill and is being kept under continuous observation.
(1) 你对我母亲得有耐心，她的耳朵越来越背了。(2) 他是一个能忍耐的人，但就连他也没法忍受那种挑衅了。(3) 对于世间美好的东西,忍耐与等待是不可缺少的。(4) 他通过耐心解释，说服了所有成员接受了他的那项建议。(5) 这位病人饮食一好，她的病情就开始好转了。(6) 病人病情严重，现接受持续观察。

translation:
n. 模式; 花样，样品; 图案; 榜样，典范
vt. 模仿; 以图案装饰
vi. 形成图案

时态：patterned, patterning, patterns
分布：模式(70%)，图案(24%)，典范(2%)，式样(2%)，以图案装饰(1%)，仿造；模仿(1%)


→来自中古英语patron,模式，模型，来自古法语patron,赞助，主顾，来自拉丁语patronus,守护圣人，保护者，来自pater,父亲，词源同father.引申词义范例，模式，样式，图案等。
n.模式,式样;图案,图样v.仿制,模仿The pattern of the battery doesn't matter to the battle against the little brittle cattle.电池的式样对与脆小牛作战无关要紧.



US ['pætˌ.ɚn] noun WAY  方式   IMPROVER  countable ■a particular way in which something is done, organized or happens 方式，形式；模式
•The pattern of family life has been changing over recent years.近年来家庭生活的模式一直在变化。

•A pattern is beginning to emerge from our analysis of the accident data.我们对意外数据进行分析后发现有种模式开始显现出来。

•In this type of mental illness, the usual pattern is bouts of depression alternating with elation.这种精神病通常的发病症状是时而萎靡不振，时而兴高采烈。

•Many behaviour(al) patterns have been identified in the chimp colony.黑猩猩群体中的许多行为模式已被识别。

UK ['pæt.ən] US ['pætˌ.ɚn] noun ARRANGEMENT  排列形式   IMPROVER  countable ■any regularly repeated arrangement, especially a design made from repeated lines, shapes or colours on a surface 图案，花样
•Look, the frost has made a beautiful pattern on the window.看啊，霜在窗户上形成了美丽的图案。

•I've never really cared for floral patterns.我从未真正喜欢过花卉图案。

UK ['pæt.ən] US ['pætˌ.ɚn] noun EXAMPLE  countable usually singular ■something which is used as an example, especially to copy 范本，典范；榜样
•The design is so good it's sure to set the pattern for many others.这个设计太好了，一定会成为许多其他设计的样板。

UK ['pæt.ən] US ['pætˌ.ɚn] noun DRAWING  图画  countable ■a drawing or shape used to show how to make something 图样，底样
•a knitting pattern编织图样

•a dress pattern服装纸样

•Cut out all of the pieces from the paper pattern and pin them on the cloth.剪下服装纸样上的每一片，把它们别在布上。

UK ['pæt.ən] US ['pætˌ.ɚn] noun PIECE  小片  countable ■a small piece of cloth or paper taken from a usual-sized piece and used to show what it looks like; a sample  样品，样本
•a pattern book样书

UK ['pæt.ən] US ['pætˌ.ɚn] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [R] pattern yourself on sb/sth ■to copy something or someone 模仿，仿效
•She patterns herself on her big sister.她学她姐姐的样。





figure, pattern, design

这组词都有“装饰图案”的意思，其区别是：
figure: 指呈现于整个表面的简单的几何图形或小型图案。
pattern: 一般指简单的重复图案，或整个装饰的格调或事物的布局，也指由一些相连图形拼成的较大图案。
design: 专指线条、轮廓、图案。强调设计的完美或有秩序。


n. 模式；图案；样品
 - mode, device, design, schema, specimen
vt. 模仿；以图案装饰
 - simulate, imitate
examples: 英 ['pætn] 美 ['pætərn]
n.模式；图案；典范；式样v.以图案装饰；仿造；模仿

(1) The two buildings are modeled after the same pattern.(2) Training and education follow different patterns in different regions.(3) This cloth has a pattern of blue and white squares.(4) Threads of different colors and textures were woven into an intricate pattern.(5) She is a pattern of virtue.(6) This company set a pattern of what a good company should be.(7) Please cut out my overcoat according to this pattern.(8) I like the carpets patterned with peonies.(9) He patterned himself upon a man he admired.(10) This is a new approach patterned on Japanese ideas.
(1) 这两座建筑是按照同一模式建造的。(2) 培训和教育在不同的地区遵循不同的模式。(3) 这种布有蓝白格子的图案。(4) 各种花色和质地的线织成了一幅复杂的图案。(5) 她是美德的典范。(6) 这家公司是好公司的典范。(7) 我这件大衣请你照这个式样裁剪。(8) 我喜欢印有牡丹花图案的地毯。(9) 他模仿一位他钦佩的人。(10) 这是模仿日本概念而设计的新方法。
[sound:youdao-38510572-3a8ac25b-49b3b721-69e8aa4c-72c0ad41.mp3]

translation:
n. 暂时的停顿; 犹豫; （诗中）节奏的停顿; [乐]延长号
vi. 暂停，中止; 逗留，停滞; （按暂停键）暂停放音; 犹豫

时态：paused, pausing, pauses
分布：暂停(50%)，停顿(42%)，中止(7%)，犹豫不决(1%)


→来自拉丁语pausa,暂停，停顿，来自希腊语pauein,停止，停息，来自paus,停止，停息，词源同pose,compose.
v./n.中止,暂停He made a short pause and then went on reading.他略顿了一下然后继续念下去.



US [pɑ:z] noun countable  ADVANCED  ■a short period in which something such as a sound or an activity is stopped before starting again 暂停
•There will be a brief pause in the proceedings while the piano is moved into place.在将钢琴搬过去放好之前，活动将暂停一会儿。

•After a long, awkward pause someone asked a question.在长得令人尴尬的停顿过后，有人问了个问题。

•She spoke for three quarters of an hour without so much as a pause.她一连说了45分钟，连停都没停一下。

•There followed a pregnant (= filled with meaning) pause in which neither of them knew what to say.接下来是意味深长的停顿，两人谁也不知道说甚么好。

UK [pɔ:z] US [pɑ:z] noun countable give sb pause formal ■to cause someone to stop and think about what they were doing or intending to do 使（某人）停下来仔细考虑
UK [pɔ:z] US [pɑ:z] verb intransitive  ADVANCED  ■to stop doing something for a short time 暂停，停顿
•He paused and thought for a moment.他停下来想了一会儿。

•She paused to get her breath back and then carried on jogging.她停下来喘了口气，接着继续慢跑。





pause, stop, break, interval, cease, recess, rest

这组词都有“中止，停止，休息”的意思，其区别是：
pause: 指短暂的中断或停止，含再进行下去的意味。
stop: 普通用词，指迅速或突然中止某行为、活动或状态。
break: 非正式用词，指突然的或短时间的中止，如工作或活动期间接短暂休息。
interval: 指一出戏在幕与幕之间，音乐会上下串场之间或演出中预先安排的休息；也可泛指事件之间的一段时间。
cease: 正式用词，侧重逐渐结呸某活动或状态，含永远结束的意味。
recess: 正式用词，指业务活动或工作中短暂的或长时间的休息。
rest: 指统称的休息。



pause, stop, cease, halt, quit

这组词都有“停止”的意思，其区别是：
pause: 指暂时的、瞬间的停顿，隐含有再进行之意。
stop: 指动作、运行、进展等被停下来，含突然、断然的意味。
cease: 指逐渐、徐徐中止某种状态的存在。书面用词。
halt: 侧重突然地、决定性地终止、停止某一活动。
quit: 指最终彻底停止某事，有时暗示遭到失败或面临挫折。


n. 暂停；间歇
 - hang, moratorium
vi. 暂停，停顿，中止；踌躇
 - stop, time out
examples: 英 [pɔːz] 美 [pɔːz]
n.暂停；中止；犹豫不决vi.停顿；中止

(1) There will be a brief pause in the program.(2) I made the classic mistake of clapping in a pause in the music!(3) There was a pregnant pause before she answered my question.(4) His words were followed by a pregnant pause.(5) Weather condition is bad enough to give pause to even the most experienced climber.(6) He paused before making the important decision.(7) A speaker should pause when coming to the end of a sentence.(8) You should pause and ponder now.(9) At the top of the rise they pause for a rest.
(1) 这个计划可能需要暂停一下。(2) 我在乐曲演奏暂停的间歇鼓起掌来，真是大错特错！(3) 她耐人寻味地停顿了一下才回答我的问题。(4) 他说完话，接着是一段意味深长的停顿。(5) 天气十分恶劣，即使最有经验的登山者也犹豫不决。(6) 他在作出这个重要决定前犹豫不决。(7) 每讲完一句话，讲话者都应该停顿一下。(8) 你现在应该停下来仔细考虑一下。(9) 他们在小山的顶部停下来休息。
[sound:youdao-392f961b-80e46e8b-cf6826a5-02dc8bae-16860b19.mp3]

translation:
vt. 铺设; 为…铺平道路; 安排
n. （用砖石）铺（地）
adj. （宝石）密镶的

时态：paved, paving, paves
分布：铺路(51%)，铺设(32%)，安排(11%)，铺满(6%)


→来自古法语paver,铺路，来自拉丁语pavire,击打，踩，践踏，来自pau,砍，击，引申词义思考，词源同pudenda,compute,putative.
v.铺砌,铺(路)By the navigation of microwave, the navy paved a pavement on the wavy sea.借助微波导航,海军在多浪的大海上铺了一条路.



verb transitive ■to cover an area of ground with a hard flat surface of pieces of stone, concrete or bricks 铺，筑（地面）
•The area from the shops to the beach is paved with bricks set in patterns.商店到海滩的这个区域是用拼花砖铺成的。

[peɪv] verb transitive pave the way ■If something paves the way for/to something else, it makes the other thing possible （为…）铺平道路，（为…）创造条件
•Scientists hope that data from the probe will pave the way for a more detailed exploration of Mars.科学家希望探测船传回的数据会为更深入的火星探索提供条件。

[peɪv] verb transitive paved with gold ■used about a city to mean that it is easy to make money there （某个城市）遍地是黄金，极容易发财
•Unemployed youngsters still come to London in their hundreds thinking that the streets are paved with gold.失业的年轻人继续成百上千地来到伦敦，认为这里遍地都是黄金。




vt. 铺设；安排；作铺设之用
 - schedule, budget, settle, place in
examples: 英 [peɪv] 美 [peɪv]
vt.铺路；铺设；铺满；安排

(1) The road was paved with cobblestones.(2) The bricks are to pave the courtyard.(3) Our garden is well paved with flowers.(4) Such achievements pave the way for computers(5) Their economic policy pave the way for industrial expansion.
(1) 那条路是用鹅卵石铺成的。(2) 这些砖要用来铺院子。(3) 我们的园子里鲜花遍地。(4) 这些成就为今后制造计算机打下了基础，(5) 他们的经济政策为工业发展铺平了道路。
[sound:youdao-0953d542-aaa060d0-6be325bf-3268c061-a7b559cb.mp3]

translation:
n. 人行道; 硬路面; 铺过的路面; [动]铺石状构造[密生的齿列等]

分布：路面(56%)，人行道(43%)，铺石；铺路材料(1%)


→来自pave,铺路，-ment,名词后缀。
人行道(pave铺路)[-ment 1.表名词"行为或结果"2.表示具体物]
n.人行道By the navigation of microwave, the navy paved a pavement on the wavy sea.借助微波导航,海军在多浪的大海上铺了一条路.



noun countable  ADVANCED  UK (US sidewalk) ■a path with a hard surface on one or both sides of a road, that people walk on 人行道
•Keep to the pavement, Rosie, there's a good girl.沿着人行道走，罗茜，乖孩子。
 ADVANCED  US ■the surface of a road when it has been covered with concrete or tarmac 铺筑过的路面




highway, route, avenue, trail, street, path, motorway, way, road, pavement, lane

这组词都有“路”的意思，其区别是：
highway: 通常指市区外可以通行各种机动车辆的交通干线。
route: 指从此处通往彼处的路线、路程等。
avenue: 在美国，指城市中一侧或两侧建筑物林立的大道或马路；而在英国则常指通住乡村大住宅、私人大庄园或两旁栽树的道路。
trail: 指人或兽在森林、荒野或山中踩出的小径或崎岖小道。
street: 尤指城市中的道路，往往一侧或两侧有高大建筑物；还可指城市小镇、近郊可供人、车、马行走的平坦道路。
path: 多指由人或动物在田间、小丘或树丛中经常走动而踩出的小路，也指公园或花园等供人走的小径。
motorway: 高速公路，新词，特指为车辆快速通行而修的专线，美语为freeway或expressway。
way: 普通用词，含义广泛，可指各种路、道或通道，也可指抽象的道路。
road: 指连接两地间供行人或车辆使用的广阔平坦的大道，多指公路，也可用于引申意义。
pavement: 在英国，多指街道两旁的人行道，而美国人常用sidewlk表示人行道。
lane: 指农村或城镇的小道或小径，也指小巷。


n. 人行道
 - sidewalk, footpath
examples: 英 ['peɪvmənt] 美 ['peɪvmənt]
n.路面；人行道；铺石；铺路材料
(1) The pavement was covered with dogs' excrement.(2) She is a pavement sweeper.(3) Tourists crowded the pavement.(4) I dropped my camera on the pavement and bust it.
(1) 便道上满是狗屎。(2) 她是一个打扫人行道的清扫工人。(3) 游客把人行道挤得水泄不通。(4) 我把照相机掉在人行道上摔坏了。
[sound:youdao-4ac35ea5-e8c01806-74c175a0-9fe8f4ed-db93c560.mp3]

translation:
n. 爪子; 手; <俚>笔迹
vt. 用爪抓; 用蹄触; 盘弄; 艰苦地行走
vi. 用爪子抓; 翻找

时态：pawed, pawing, paws
分布：爪子(69%)，抓(15%)，翻找(7%)，脚爪(7%)，粗鲁地摸(1%)，以蹄扒(1%)


→来自古法语powe,爪子，拳头，词源不详。来自ped,脚，词源同foot,biped.
n.爪The drawer put the strawberries and raw paws into a drawer in the saw-mill.绘图者把草莓和生熊掌放进锯板厂的抽屉里.



US [pɑ:] noun  ADVANCED  countable ■the foot of an animal which has claws or nails, such as a cat, dog or bear 爪，爪子
•I found paw prints in the kitchen.我在厨房里发现了爪印。
 Compare hoof countable usually plural informal humorous ■a human hand 手
•Take your filthy paws off my nice clean washing!把你的脏手从我洗得干干净净的衣服上拿开！

UK [pɔ:] US [pɑ:] verb intransitive or transitive ■to touch something with a paw 用爪子抓（或扒）
•When their dog heard them it began pawing (at) the ground in excitement.他们的狗听见他们的声音就开始兴奋地用爪子抓地。
transitive informal ■to feel or touch someone roughly with the hands, especially in an unpleasant sexual way 摸弄，抓捏；（尤指）猥亵地动手动脚



vt. 抓，扒；亲昵地抚摸
 - hent, scratch
vi. 用爪子抓；翻找
 - hunt throw
n. 爪子；手
 - hand, danny
examples: 英 [pɔː] 美 [pɔː]
n.脚爪；爪子；手v.以蹄扒；抓；粗鲁地摸；翻找

(1) The kitten has very soft paws.(2) The dog gave a yelp when I trod on its paw.(3) The dog was howling its paw was hurt.(4) The bull pawed the ground before charging.(5) The dog pawed at the bone.(6) That old man is always trying to paw me at the pub.(7) He pawed frantically through the drawers.
(1) 小猫的爪子很软。(2) 我踩了那狗的爪子，它嚎叫了一声。(3) 那条狗在嗥叫--它的爪子受伤了。(4) 那头牛用蹄刨着地准备出击。(5) 狗用爪子抓骨头。(6) 那个老男人在酒吧里老想吃我豆腐。(7) 他拼命翻找抽屉里的东西。
[sound:youdao-9514702f-6604cce1-b6ebc842-6ed11be9-d51004ca.mp3]

translation:
vt. & vi. 付款; 偿还; 补偿; （对…）有利
vt. 给予; 支付
n. 工资; 薪水; 报答
adj. 收费的; 需付费的

时态：paid, paying, pays
分布：支付(71%)，付出代价(10%)，薪资(9%)，雇用(3%)，受益(3%)，有良好信用的人(1%)，具有开采价值的(1%)，赢利(1%)，要钱的(1%)


→来自古法语paier,支付，来自拉丁语pacare,平息，安抚，使满意，来自pacis,和平，平静，词源同peace,pacify.
v.付款,付出代价,给予注意n.工资,薪金Yes, yesterday was the my pay-day; I pay you the payment today.是的,昨天是我的发薪日,我今天付给你报酬.



verb (paid, paid)BUY  购买   ESSENTIAL  intransitive or transitive ■to give money to someone for something you want to buy or for services provided 付费；付酬
•How much did you pay for the tickets?你买那些票花了多少钱？

•I pay my taxes.我缴付税款。

•Will you pay these cheques into (US usuallydeposit  these checks  in)my account for me?替我把这些支票存进帐户里好吗？

•[+ two objects] I'll pay you the fiver back tomorrow.我明天还你那五英镑。

•I paid the driver (in/with) cash.我给司机付现金。

•Would you prefer to pay with/by cash, cheque or credit card?你喜欢用现金、支票还是信用卡付款？

•[+ obj + to infinitive] I think we'll need to pay a builder to take this wall down.我想我们要雇个建筑工人来拆掉这面墙。

•Did Linda pay you for  looking after her cats while she was away?琳达出门时请你替她照顾她的猫，有没有付钱给你？

•I paid (out) a lot of money to get the washing machine fixed and it still doesn't work!我花了一大笔钱修洗衣机，结果还是不能用！
pay for itself ■If something pays for itself, it works so well that it saves the same amount of money that it cost 使损益相当；回本
•The advertising should pay for itself.这则广告所带来的收益应该能回本。
  Common Learner Errors   payWhen the direct object of pay is the thing that you buy, pay  is always followed by 'for':✗ You have to pay the tickets in advance.You have to pay for the tickets in advance.In all other cases, pay  is followed by the direct or indirect object only:You have to pay the bill in advance.You have to pay £20 in advance.You have to pay the driver in advance.
[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)WORK  工作   ESSENTIAL  intransitive or transitive ■to give money to someone for work which they have done 付钱（给…），支付（…）报酬
•The company pays £220 a week for people to act as couriers.该公司向那些担任信差的人支付每周220英镑的工资。

•Accountancy may be boring but at least it pays well.当会计可能很乏味，但至少收入可观。

•Most of these women are very poorly paid and work in terrible conditions.这些妇女大多工资微薄，且工作条件恶劣。

[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)PROFIT  益处   ADVANCED  intransitive ■to give a profit or advantage to someone or something 有收益，有利可图，有好处
•It never pays to take risks where human safety is concerned.凡是涉及人身安全时，冒险绝不会有甚么好处。

[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)GIVE  给予   ADVANCED  transitive ■to give or do something 给予，致以；进行
•Please pay attention , I've got something important to say.请注意，我有件重要的事要说。

•The commander paid tribute to the courage of his troops.指挥官极力赞扬部队官兵的勇敢无畏。

•It's always nice to be paid a compliment.获得赞扬总是件好事。

•A crowd of mourners gathered to pay their respects to the dead man.一群哀悼者聚集在一起向死者告别。
pay (sb) a call ■to visit someone 拜访（某人）
•I'll pay you a call when I'm in the area.我到这一带附近时会去拜访你的。

•If you leave your address, I'll pay a call on you when I'm in the area.如果你留下地址，我到这一带附近时会去拜访你的。

[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)He who pays the piper calls the tune. saying ■said to emphasize that the person who is paying someone to do something can decide how it should be done 谁是老板谁说了算。／财大者气粗。
[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)pay your dues ■to do something that you do not enjoy in order to have something that you want, or because you feel it is your duty （为得到自己想要的而）做自己不喜欢的事；尽职
[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)pay your way ■to pay for yourself rather than allowing someone else to pay 自己支付费用，自食其力
[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)pay dividends ■If something you do pays dividends, it causes good results at a time in the future （将来）有好处，得到好结果
•All that extra training is paying dividends.那些额外训练全都会使人得到回报的。

[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)pay the price  ADVANCED  ■to experience the bad result of something you have done 吃苦头，付出代价
•If you abuse your body now, you'll pay the price when you're older.如果你现在糟蹋自己的身体，年纪大了会吃苦头的。

[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)pay the ultimate price ■to die because of something you have done, especially something you do for moral reasons （尤指出于道义）献出生命
•If our soldiers have to pay the ultimate price for defending their country, then so be it.如果我们的士兵需要为保卫祖国而牺牲生命，那也在所不惜。

[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)pay through the nose informal ■to pay too much money for something 付费过高；花钱过多
•We paid through the nose to get the car fixed and it still doesn't go properly.我们修这辆车花费不菲，结果还是不能正常行驶。

[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)pay top dollar US ■to pay a lot of money for something 所费不赀
[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)put paid to sth UK ■to finish or destroy something 结束，了结；毁掉
•A knee injury has put paid to her chances of getting into the final.一次膝盖受伤断送了她进入决赛的机会。

[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)You pays your money and you takes your choice/chance. informal saying ■You are responsible for your decisions and cannot blame anyone else when what you have chosen is not successful. 自己选择自己承担后果。
[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] pay sb/sth back  ADVANCED  ■to pay someone the money that you owe them 偿还（钱）；还（某人）钱
•Can you lend me a fiver? I'll pay you/it back tomorrow.能借我五英镑吗？我明天还你。

[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)  Phrasal Verbs   pay sb back ■to do something unpleasant to someone because they have done something unpleasant to you 使（某人）付出代价，向（某人）报复
•He swore he'd pay her back for all she'd done to him.他发誓要使她为对自己所做的一切付出代价。

[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)  Phrasal Verbs   pay for sth ■to be punished for doing something bad to someone else, or to suffer because of a mistake that you made 为…付出代价，因…得到报应
•We all pay for our mistakes in some way at some time.我们都会在某个时候以某种方式为我们所犯的错误付出代价。

•He tricked me and I'm going to make him pay for it!他欺骗了我，我会让他得到报应的！

[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] pay sth in (US usually deposit) ■to put money into a bank account 把（钱）存入银行帐户
•If you go to the bank, will you pay these cheques in for me?你去银行的话能帮我把这些支票存进去吗？

[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)  Phrasal Verbs   pay off ■If something you have done pays off, it is successful 取得成功，得到好结果
•All her hard work paid off in the end, and she finally passed the exam.她的所有努力最终有了收获——她终于通过了考试。

[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] pay sth off ■to pay back money that you owe 还清（欠款）
•We should be able to pay off the debt within two years.我们应该能在两年内还清债务。

[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] pay sb off ■If your employer pays you off, they pay you for the last time and then end your job, because they do not need you or could not pay you in the future. 付清工资后遣散（某人）■informal ■to give someone money so that they will not do or say something, or so that they will go away 用钱封住（某人）的嘴，收买（某人）
•There were rumours that key witnesses had been paid off to keep quiet.谣传说关键证人都被收买了，不肯出面作证。

[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] pay (sth) out ■to spend a lot of money on something, or to pay a lot of money to someone （为…）付出大笔钱，（向…）支付大笔资金
•I've just paid out £500 on getting the car fixed.我刚刚花了500英镑的高价修理那辆车。

[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)  Phrasal Verbs   [M] pay sth out ■to release a piece of rope or cable in a controlled way 小心地放出（绳索）
§/peɪ]
pay 1	 verb (paid, paid)  Phrasal Verbs   pay up informal ■to give someone the money that you owe them, especially when you do not want to （尤指不情愿地）付清欠款，偿还欠款
•Eventually they paid up, but only after receiving several reminders.最终他们还清了欠款，但那是在他们再三收到提示信以后的事。

[peɪ] verb (paid, paid)  Common Learner Errors   payWarning:  Check your verb endings!Many learners make mistakes when using pay in the past tense.In the past simple and past participle, don't write 'paied' or 'payed', write paid.The -ing  form is paying.
[peɪ] noun uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■the money you receive for doing a job 工资，薪金
•UK Any pay rise (US usuallyraise)must be in line with inflation.工资的增长必须与通货膨胀同步。

•It's a nice job but the pay is appalling.这份工作不错，但工资低得不像话。
be in the pay of sb ■to work for someone, especially secretly （尤指秘密地）受雇于（某人）
[peɪ] noun uncountable   Common Learner Errors   pay, wage, salary,  or  income?Pay is a general word which means the money that you receive for working.Doctors usually get more pay than teachers.A wage is an amount of money you receive each day or week. It is often paid in cash  (= notes and coins).His weekly wage is $400.A salary is the money you receive each month. A person's salary is often expressed as the total amount in a year.His salary is £20, 000.Your income is the total amount of money that you get by working or other sources.She has a monthly income of £1, 400.




take, pay, cost, spend

take: 物做主语,花时间;
pay: 人做主语,花钱,pay for;
cost: 物做主语,花钱
spend: 人做主语,花钱,花时间; spend…on sth./in doing sth;



fee, earnings, wage, allowance, income, pay, salary

这组词都有“工资、收入”的意思，其区别是：
fee: 指提供某种服务收取的固定费用。
earnings: 多指通过劳动或投资等手段所得到的收入。
wage: 多用复数形式，指按小时、日或星期的报酬，通常指体力劳动者的工资。
allowance: 指收入中的补贴部分。
income: 与earnings含义很相近，但前者强调总收入。
pay: 是个通用词，可取代salary与wage.
salary: 指按年定下，按月或星期平均给予的报酬，指脑力劳动者的薪水。


vt. 支付，付；偿还，补偿
 - replace, foot, tender
vi. [会计] 付款；偿还
 - shell out, repay
n. [劳经] 工资，薪水； [会计] 付款
 - payment, salary, wage
examples: 英 [peɪ] 美 [peɪ]
v.支付；赢利；受益；付出代价n.薪资；雇用；有良好信用的人adj.要钱的；具有开采价值的

(1) I'd like to pay with my credit card.(2) My firm pays well.(3) Let me pay for dinner.(4) You've got to be able to make your business pay well.(5) It would probably pay you to hire an accountant.(6) He'll have to pay for what he has done.(7) He doesn't like that job, but the pay is good.(8) The workers in our pay work very hard.(9) This is a pay telephone.(10) There is a pay streak here.
(1) 我想用信用卡支付。(2) 我公司工酬优厚。(3) 晚饭让我来付。(4) 你得设法使你的生意赢利。(5) 聘一位会计师或许对你有好处。(6) 他将为自己所做的一切付出代价。(7) 他不喜欢那工作,但薪水很高。(8) 我们雇用的员工工作很努力。(9) 这是缴费电话。(10) 这里有开采价值的矿层。

translation:
n. 付款，支付; 报酬，报答; 偿还; 惩罚，报应

分布：支付(91%)，报应(5%)，报偿(2%)，支付的款项(2%)


→来自pay,支付，-ment,名词后缀。
n.支付,付款额Yes, yesterday was the my pay-day; I pay you the payment today.是的,昨天是我的发薪日,我今天付给你报酬.



noun  ESSENTIAL  countable or uncountable ■an amount of money paid 支付的金额
•Usually we ask for payment on receipt of the goods.我们通常要求对方货到付款。

•We need a deposit of £165 followed by twelve monthly payments of £60.你需要先付165英镑的订金，之后12个月内每月支付60英镑。

•When is the first payment due ?第一期付款甚么时候到期？
[S or U] ■reward 报偿，报答
•Verbal abuse was hardly the payment I expected for my troubles.我花了那么多力气，没料到换来的是一顿辱骂。
back payment ■a sum of money received by an employee because of a pay rise at an earlier time （因早些时候涨工资而得到的）补发工资



n. 付款， [会计] 支付；报酬，报答；偿还；惩罚，报应
 - compensation, punishment, consideration, rod, discipline
examples: 英 ['peɪmənt] 美 ['peɪmənt]
n.支付；支付的款项；报偿；报应

(1) You may defer payment until next week.(2) We have still not yet received your payment.(3) The payment is made without official sanction.(4) Is this all the payment I get for my efforts?(5) These cookies should be considered as payment for your services.
(1) 你可延期至下周支付。(2) 我们仍未收到贵公司支付的款项。(3) 该款是在没有官方允许情况下支付的。(4) 这就是对我辛劳的全部报偿吗?(5) 请把这些饼干当成是对您服务的报偿吧。

translation:
n. 豌豆，豌豆类; 豌豆状物; 〈美俚〉棒球

分布：豌豆(100%)


→来自中古英语pease,豌豆，后谬误该词为复数形式而缩略为pea.
n.豌豆Each pea and peach on the beach can be reached by the peacock.海滩上的每一颗豌豆和桃子孔雀都能触及.



noun countable  ADVANCED  ■a round green seed, several of which grow in a pod, eaten as a vegetable 豌豆
•frozen/dried peas冷冻／晒干的豌豆

•pea soup豌豆汤




n. [作物] 豌豆
 - pease
examples: 英 [piː] 美 [piː]
n.豌豆
(1) This kind of pea has a long pod.(2) Pea pods burst open when overripe.(3) We have a bowl of very salty pea and ham soup.(4) The sisters are as alike as two peas.
(1) 这种豌豆长着长豆荚。(2) 豌豆过熟就会爆裂。(3) 我们喝了一碗非常咸的豌豆火腿汤。(4) 两姐妹长得一模一样。

translation:
adj. 和平的; 爱好和平的; 安静的; 平静的

分布：和平的(86%)，安宁的(14%)


a.和平的,平静的,安宁的,爱好和平的I paced in the peaceful spacecraft.我在宁静的宇宙飞船里踱步.



adjective NO VIOLENCE  和平的   IMPROVER  ■without violence 和平的
•peaceful demonstrators和平示威者

•She hoped the different ethnic groups in the area could live together in peaceful co-existence.她希望该地区不同的种族群体能和平共处。

['pi:s.fəl] adjective CALM  宁静的   IMPROVER  ■quiet and calm 安静的，宁静的
•a peaceful afternoon/place安静的下午／地方





noiseless, silent, calm, peaceful, serene, still, quiet

这组词都有“平静的，无声无息”的意思，其区别是：
noiseless: 指无任何噪音或不出声，无声无息。
silent: 普通用词，指缄默不语或无声无息。
calm: 普通用词，既可指天气、海洋等的平静状态，又可指人的镇定沉着、不慌乱，不受外界影响和情绪支配。
peaceful: 普通用词，指一种不受外物扰乱和刺激的内在宁静或和平状态。
serene: 指一种超脱一切烦恼的宁静状态。
still: 指平静而又安定的状态。
quiet: 普通用词，指没有喧闹、活动或骚乱的寂静状态。


adj. 和平的，爱好和平的；平静的
 - pacific, calm, still
examples: 英 ['piːsfl] 美 ['piːsfl]
adj.和平的；安宁的

(1) Hopes of a peaceful settlement are now fading.(2) China is a peaceful country.(3) The world today is far from peaceful.(4) Law and order are necessary for a peaceful society.(5) My husband loves adventurous life while I enjoy a more peaceful domestic life.
(1) 和平解决的希望正在消失。(2) 中国是一个爱好和平的国家。(3) 今天的世界还很不安宁。(4) 法律和秩序对于社会安宁是必需的。(5) 我丈夫喜欢充满冒险的生活，而我则喜欢宁静的家居生活。
[sound:youdao-ddf7a9bf-7c3f31b3-95de4d10-0139bed8-dd0b1b4d.mp3]

translation:
n. 桃子; 桃红色; 极好的人（或物）
adj. 桃红色的; 粉红色的

时态：peached, peaching, peaches
分布：桃子(49%)，桃树(44%)，桃红色(7%)


→来自古法语pesche,来自拉丁语pessica,来自persica拼写变体，缩写自malum Persicum,翻译自希腊语Persikon malon,波斯苹果，词源同Persian.该水果原产于中国，约公元前300年从波斯进入希腊因而称为波斯苹果。
n.桃,桃树Each pea and peach on the beach can be reached by the peacock.海滩上的每一颗豌豆和桃子孔雀都能触及.



noun FRUIT  水果   ADVANCED  countable or uncountable ■a round fruit with sweet yellow flesh that has a lot of juice, a slightly furry red and yellow skin and a large seed in its centre 桃（子）
•Would you like peaches and cream for dessert?你想来点蜜桃冰淇淋当甜点吗？

[pi:tʃ] noun EXCELLENT  极好的  only singular informal ■someone or something which is excellent or very pleasing 杰出的人；极好的东西；特别讨人喜欢的人（或物）
[pi:tʃ] noun COLOUR  颜色  uncountable ■a pale colour between pink and orange 桃红色
[pi:tʃ] adjective ■having a pale colour between pink and orange 桃红色的



n. 桃子； [园艺] 桃树；桃红色；受人喜欢的人（或物）
 - fushia, cherry red
vi. 告密
 - inform, rat
vt. 告发
 - tell on, blow the whistle
examples: 英 [piːtʃ] 美 [piːtʃ]
n.桃子；桃树；桃红色
(1) The peach is a sweet and juicy fruit.(2) The beauty of the peach blossom is beyond description.(3) There is a peach standing by the lake.(4) Peach is the most popular color this season.
(1) 桃子是甜又多汁的水果。(2) 桃花的美丽难以形容。(3) 湖边有棵桃树。(4) 桃红色是这一季最受欢迎的颜色。
