[praɪd] noun have / take pride of place ■to have the most important position in a group of things 占据最重要的地位
•A portrait of the earl takes pride of place in the entrance hall.一幅伯爵的肖像挂在门厅最突出的位置上。

[praɪd] noun Pride comes / goes before a fall. saying ■said to emphasize that if you are too confident about your abilities, something bad will happen which shows that you are not as good as you think 骄兵必败。
[praɪd] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [R] pride yourself on sth ■to value a skill or good quality that you have 为…而自豪；对…引以为荣
•He prides himself on his loyalty to his friends.他以自己对朋友的忠诚而自豪。





pride, boast, brag, crow

这组词都有“自夸，吹嘘”的意思，其区别是：
pride: 与boast的意义较接近，指炫耀、夸口，自鸣得意，常与反身代词连用。
boast: 普通用词，指对自己所做的事，自己的长处、财富以及家庭等的夸耀，常含言过其实的意味。
brag: 非正式用词，其夸耀和吹嘘意味强于boast，到了过分夸大，有时令人讨厌的地步。
crow: 多指大声吵嚷地吹嘘，夸耀自己做某事比他人做得好。


n. 自豪；骄傲；自尊心
 - selfrespect, pretension
vt. 使得意，以…自豪
 - exalt
vi. 自豪
 - glory, be proud of
examples: 英 [praɪd] 美 [praɪd]
n.骄傲；自豪；自尊心；引以自豪的东西vt.以 ... 自豪

(1) My teaching is my pride and joy.(2) Pride was his downfall.(3) She takes great pride in her children's success.(4) He looked at his children with evident pride.(5) Having to accept the money was a blow to her pride.(6) I think you hurt his pride by laughing at the way he speaks English.(7) The new car was the pride of the whole family.(8) He prides himself on remaining calm in an emergency.
(1) 我的教学工作是我的快乐和骄傲。(2) 骄傲是他垮台的原因。(3) 她为自己的孩子取得的成绩感到无比骄傲。(4) 他看着自己的孩子,充满自豪。(5) 她不得不接受这笔钱，这是对她自尊心的打击。(6) 我觉得你嘲笑他说英语的方式刺伤了他的自尊心。(7) 新汽车是全家人引以自豪之物。(8) 他在紧急关头十分镇静为此感到骄傲。
[sound:youdao-3d85ce33-a6edce38-6fdc9207-3f58e93d-8505a13e.mp3]

translation:
n. 神父，牧师; 司铎，司祭; 领导者; 神甫
vt. 使成为神职人员

分布：牧师(59%)，神父(28%)，教士(11%)，僧侣(1%)，泰斗(1%)


→来自古英语preost,祭司，神父，来自拉丁语presbyter,长者，老人，词源同presbytery.
n.教士,神父The pretty priest protested the contest of protein test.漂亮牧师抗议蛋白质化验赛.



noun countable  IMPROVER  ■a person, usually a man, who has been trained to perform religious duties in the Christian Church, especially the Roman Catholic Church, or a person with particular duties in some other religions 神父，牧师，司铎；（基督教以外的）神职人员
•Father O'Dooley was ordained a priest in 1949.奥杜利神父是1949年被授予神父职位的。

•Many in the Anglican Church are still opposed to women priests.英国圣公会中的许多人仍然抵制女祭司。





priest, father

这两个名词均与宗教中的神职人员有关。
priest: 牧师，指天主教及东正教中一个有权执行圣礼的教士。
father: 神父，神甫，指对教士的尊称。


n. 牧师；神父；教士
 - minister, father, preacher
examples: 英 [priːst] 美 [priːst]
n.教士；神父；牧师；僧侣；泰斗
(1) A priest exorcized the ghost from the house.(2) The priest confessed the young man.(3) The priest pronounced them man and wife.(4) The priest persuaded him to give up his bad habit.
(1) 教士将鬼从房屋中驱走。(2) 神父听取那个青年的忏悔。(3) 神父宣布他们已结为夫妇。(4) 牧师劝他放弃坏习惯。
[sound:youdao-8bcebf33-d114ff11-5562fd70-3a56ad33-b65b9e79.mp3]

translation:
adv. 首先; 首要地，主要地; 根本上; 本来

分布：主要地(80%)，起初地(20%)


adverb  ADVANCED  ■mainly 主要地
•We're primarily concerned with keeping expenditure down.我们主要关心的是缩减开支。

•Soccer is primarily a winter game.英式足球基本上是一项冬季运动。





principally, mainly, generally, largely, chiefly, primarily, mostly, greatly

这组词都有“主要地，大量地”的意思，其区别是：
principally: 侧重居首要地位。
mainly: 指主要部分，突出在一系列事物中的相对重要性。
generally: 通常强调普遍性。
largely: 着重范围或分量大大超过别的成分。
chiefly: 侧重某人或某物在众多的人或物中占主要和显著地位。
primarily: 侧重基本地，首要地。
mostly: 强调数量占多半，近乎全部。
greatly: 通常强调程度的高。


adv. 首先；主要地，根本上
 - firstly, basically, mainly, mostly, largely
examples: 英 [praɪ'merəli] 美 [praɪ'merəli]
adv.主要地；起初地

(1) Most linguists would say they were concerned primarily with the structure of languages.(2) He is primarily liable for his debt.(3) This building was primarily intended to be a dinning hall.(4) Primarily a teacher, she later became a writer.
(1) 大多数语言学家都会说，他们主要研究各种语言的结构。(2) 他对债务负主要责任或他是主要债务人。(3) 这座建筑原来是打算用作餐厅的。(4) 她原先是教师，后来成了作家。

translation:
adj. 首要的，主要的; 最早的，原始的; [地质学]原生的; 基本的
n. 第一位; 最好者; 要素; 候选人提拔会

分布：主要的(48%)，原色(10%)，首要的(9%)，初级的(9%)，初选(8%)，要素(4%)，第一位(3%)，最主要者(3%)，初期的(2%)，初级线圈(2%)，根本的(2%)


→来自prime,第一的，最初的，首要的，-ary,形容词后缀。
最初的;根本的(prim+ary)[prim=first,chief表示"第一,主要的"]
a.最初的,初级的;首要的,主要的,基本的A primary school is the first school everybody goes to.小学是所有的人上的第一个学校.



US [-mɚ.i] adjective MOST IMPORTANT  最重要的   IMPROVER  ■more important than anything else; main 首要的；主要的
•The Red Cross's primary concern is to preserve and protect human life.红十字会最关心的是维护人的生命安全。

•The primary responsibility lies with those who break the law.主要的责任在于那些违法者。

UK ['praɪ.mə.ri] US [-mɚ.i] adjective EDUCATION  教育  [before noun] UK and Australian English ■of or for the teaching of young children, especially those between five and eleven years old 初等教育的，小学的
•primary education初等教育

•a primary school小学

UK ['praɪ.mə.ri] US [-mɚ.i] adjective EARLIEST  最早的  ■happening first 最初的，起源的，原始的
•the primary stages of development发展的最初阶段

UK ['praɪ.mə.ri] US [-mɚ.i] noun countable ■in the United States, an election in which people who belong to a political party choose who will represent that party in an election for political office （美国推举党内候选人的）初选




primary, elemental, elementary

这组词都有“基本的”的意思，其区别是：
primary: 可与作“初步的，初级”的elementary换用。
elemental: 强调属于事物的基础或本质。
elementary: 指属于事物的初步或起始阶段



principal, leading, primary, foremost, capital, major, chief, main

这组词都有“首要的，主要的”的意思，其区别是：
principal: 用于人时，指地位优于其他人；用于物时，指该物在大小、重要性等方面优于他物。
leading: 侧重指具有影响力或凝聚力。从而有主导和引导的作用。
primary: 通常不用于人。用于物时，指在重要性方面占第一位。
foremost: 侧重指在行进或发展过程中居首位。
capital: 着重指因重要性、意义、优越或重大而名列同类之首。
major: 指同其他人或其它物、问题等相比较，显得更加重要和突出。
chief: 拽人时，表同类中职位最高，权力最大；指物时，表同类中最重要，价值最高。
main: 通常只用于物。指在一定范围内，某物的重要性、体积或力量等超过其它物。


adj. 主要的； [数] 初级的；基本的
 - elementary, major, central, main, leading
n. 原色；最主要者
 - original color, fundamental colour
examples: 英 ['praɪməri] 美 ['praɪmeri]
adj.首要的；主要的；初级的；初等教育的；根本的；初期的n.第一位；初选；最主要者；要素；原色；初级线圈

(1) The primary task for socialism is to develop the productive forces.(2) Another primary reason is that there seems to be too many private cars and not enough public buses.(3) The demand for primary products is on the increase in European market.(4) Primary education comes under the umbrella of local government.(5) This is the primary source from which human knowledge develops.(6) A primary disease arises spontaneously with no apparent external symptoms.(7) We should place development on the primary in governing and rejuvenating the country.(8) Collins was nosed out by his opponent in the primary.(9) Nowadays, technology has become the primary factor in the economy development and many people begin to question Marx's theory on labor value.(10) These are created by combining the primary colors.(11) "(actors, singers, etc.) perform for outside salary income without approval by the unit they belong to"(12) In one way, primary and secondary coils are wound around the space.(13) An electric transformer changes the alternating voltage applied to it in proportion to the numbers of turns in its primary and secondary windings.

(1) 社会主义的首要任务是发展社会生产力。(2) 另一个主要原因是私家车过多而公交车不够。(3) 欧洲市场对初级产品的需求在增长。(4) 小学教育受地方政府的保护。(5) 这是人类认识发展的根源。(6) 处于初期阶段的疾病发生时没有明显的外在症状。(7) 我们应将发展放在执政兴国中的第一位。(8) 柯林斯在初选中就被他的对手击败了。(9) 摘要当今世界，科技已成为推动经济的第一要素，不少人开始对马克思的劳动价值论提出质疑。(10) 这些颜色通过混合原色形成。(11) 走穴(12) 有一种方法是把初级线圈和次级线圈绕在这个地方。(13) 变压器其交变电压的改变与初级线圈及其次级线圈的匝数成正比。
[sound:youdao-bfb4f085-c3df3f92-7bba9ee2-f6916047-6fd4f31a.mp3]

translation:
adj. 最好的; 首要的; 最初的; 基本的
n. 精华; 初期; 全盛时期; 青年
vt. 使准备好; 填装; 事先指导
adv. 极好地
vi. （为枪炮）装火药; 涂底漆; 修剪树枝; 注水入泵引起

时态：primed, priming, primes
分布：最好的(33%)，壮年(17%)，全盛时期(14%)，首要的(12%)，典型的(9%)，青春(9%)，变得首要(4%)，事先指点(2%)


→来自拉丁语primus,第一的，最初的，首要的，来自古拉丁语pri,在前，来自per,向前，在前，词源同ford,first.-im,最高级后缀，词源同ultimate,maximum.
最初的,基本的[prim=first,chief表示"第一,主要的"]
a.首要的;最好的,第一流的n.青春,全盛期Primarily, the prime criminal's crime has nothing to do with lime and overtime.首犯的犯罪基本上与石灰和加班无关.
【记】源于：prim（adj 整洁的；最好的；早的）【参】primate（n 首领；灵长类的动物），最早的动物－灵长类；primer（n 初级读本）；primeval（adj 原始的）【反】uninitial（adj 未蒙损失的；未受伤害的）



adjective [before noun]  IMPROVER  ■main or most important 首要的，主要的；基本的
•This is a prime example of 1930s architecture.这是20世纪30年代建筑风格的一个重要范例。

•the prime suspect in a murder investigation谋杀案调查中的主要嫌疑犯

•a prime source of evidence证据的主要来源

•The president is a prime (= likely) target for the assassin's bullet.总统是这名刺客的主要目标。
 IMPROVER  ■of the best quality 品质最好的，一流的
•prime beef上等牛肉

•The hotel is in a prime location in the city centre.该旅馆位于市中心的黄金地段。

[praɪm] noun only singular ■the period in your life when you are most active or successful 全盛时期；盛年，壮年时期
•This is a dancer in her prime.这是一位正值巅峰时期的女舞蹈家。

•Middle age can be the prime of life if you have the right attitude.如果心态正确，中年会是人一生中的全盛时期。

•I suspect this cheese is past its prime.我觉得这块起司已经不那么新鲜了。

[praɪm] verb transitive ■to tell someone something that will prepare them for a particular situation 事先给（某人）提供情况，使有所准备
•I'd been primed so I knew not to mention her son.因为事先得到提醒，所以我知道别提起她的儿子。
■to cover the surface of wood with a special paint before the main paint is put on 在（木质表面）上涂底漆（或底色）■to make a bomb or gun ready to explode or fire 为…装雷管（或火药）




prime, first-rate, choice, select, splendid, excellent

这组词都有“极好的”的意思，其区别是：
prime: 常指最重要、价值最高的东西，也可以表示最佳、最典型或最高的人或物。
first-rate: 多用于指对抽象事物的主观评估，有时含夸大、自负的意味。
choice: 指通过精心挑选达到水平，尤指罕见或品质精良的商品。
select: 指精挑细选出来作为范例的物或人。
splendid: 口语常用词，指非常令人满意，显得完美无缺。
excellent: 通常指事物在等级品位以及职位级别等方面的最优或接近最优。


adj. 主要的；最好的；基本的
 - greatest, major, elementary, central, main
adv. 极好地
 - excellently, famously
n. 初期；青年；精华；全盛时期
 - youth, morning, essence, elite, flower
vt. 使准备好；填装
 - ready
vi. 作准备
 - provide
examples: 英 [praɪm] 美 [praɪm]
adj.最好的；首要的；典型的n.壮年；全盛时期；青春n.[数]质数vt.事先指点；在（金属、木材等上）打底漆vi.变得首要

(1) He reached his prime and then, when he had the most to live for, he died.(2) We were well prime for the journey with a large breakfast.(3) What was said was of prime importance.(4) Britain has a queen, but it is the prime minister and the cabinet who govern.(5) The building is a prime example of 1960s architecture.(6) He died in the prime of his life.(7) Young people are in their prime.(8) Many young soldiers were cut off in their prime.(9) She had the strength and sangfroid of a woman in the prime of life.(10) It states that every even number greater than two can be expressed as the sum of two primes (a prime is a number that is only divisible by itself and by 1, such as 7 and 13).(11) She has been well primed about what to say.(12) You must prime the wood before you paint it.(13) Peace is the prime objective of our foreign policy.(14) The telecom hotels are prime targets for bombing.

(1) 他到了壮年时期,该做出最大贡献,活得最好的时候,却死掉了。(2) 为了去旅行,我们早餐都吃得饱饱的。(3) 说过的那件事是很重要的。(4) 英国有女王,但执政的是首相和内阁。(5) 这座大楼是20世纪60年代的典型建筑。(6) 他在壮年时死去。(7) 年轻人风华正茂。(8) 许多士兵都英年早逝。(9) 她具有正值青春的少妇的力量和沉着。(10) 其陈述是：每一个大于2的偶数都可以表达成两个素数之和(素数是指只能被1和它本身整除的数，如7和13)。(11) 她已经有人指点,知道要说些什么。(12) 油漆这木制东西前,你得先在上面涂上底漆。(13) 我们把争取和平作为对外政策的首要任务。(14) 电信宾馆是轰炸的首要目标。
[sound:youdao-138132b8-7b11b141-ae45e05f-fe2aef4c-b75bf86d.mp3]

translation:
adj. 原始的; 发展水平低的; 落后的; [生物学]原生的
n. 原始人; 早期的艺术家（作品）; 单纯的人：不世故的人; 自学的艺术家

分布：原始的(79%)，原始人(19%)，简陋的(1%)，文艺复兴前的艺术家(1%)


→来自prime,第一的，最初的，原始的，-itive,形容词后缀。
原始的(prim+itive)[prim=first,chief表示"第一,主要的"]
原始的(prim最初的,原始)[-itive表形容词"…的"]
a.原始的,远古的,早期的;粗糙的,简单的Primitive men lived in caves.原始人住在山洞里.



US [-tˌɪv] adjective  ADVANCED  ■relating to human society at a very early stage of development, with people living in a simple way without machines or a writing system 原始的，早期的，远古的
•Primitive races colonized these islands 2000 years ago.原始种族2000年前开拓了这些岛屿。

•primitive man原始人

•The spiny anteater is a mammal, although a very primitive one.针鼹属于哺乳动物，尽管是非常原始的一种。
 ADVANCED  disapproving ■describes living conditions that are basic, unpleasant and uncomfortable 无现代设施的，简陋的
•Early settlers had to cope with very primitive living conditions.早期殖民者不得不克服非常原始的生存条件。





raw, original, primitive

raw: 原始的
original: 最初的，独特的
primitive: 原始的



initial, original, primitive

initial: a.开始的，最初的，强调处于事物的起始阶段，也可以指位于开头地方的。
 • My initial good opinion of him changed with time.   时间长了我对他最初的好印象改变了。
original: a.最初的，最早的；原版的，原物的。指按顺序是首位的，在此前不再有更为原始的同类的东西；也指原件的，原物的，非仿造的东西。
 • This is the original piano on which the composer created some of his greatest works.   就是在这架钢琴上，这位作曲家创作出了他的一些伟大的作品。
primitive: a.原始的，上古的，早期的，指处于人类生命或事物发展的早期阶段，也可以指自然的或简朴的。
 • Primitive tribes live in the Amazon River basin.   原始部落居住在亚马逊河盆地。


adj. [数]  [生物]  [地质] 原始的，远古的；简单的，粗糙的
 - original, simple, crude, plain, rough

translation:
n. 王子; 巨头; （某些欧洲国家的）贵族; 小国的君主

分布：王子(94%)，亲王(5%)，诸侯(1%)


→来自古法语prince,王子，王公，来自拉丁语princeps,国王，统治者，酋长，来自primus,第一的，首要的，-cep,拿，带，承担，词源同capable,accept.后词义扩大为小国的君主，国君等。拼写比较single,simple.
n.王子,亲王The prince and princess lived a happy life ever since.王子和公主从此过着幸福的生活.



noun countable  IMPROVER  ■an important male member of a royal family, especially a son or grandson of the king or queen 王子；亲王；王孙
•Prince Edward爱德华王子

•Prince Juan Carlos of Spain became king in 1975.胡安‧卡洛斯王子于1975年成为西班牙国王。
 IMPROVER  ■a male ruler of a country, usually a small country （通常指小国的）国君
•Prince Rainier is the ruling prince of Monaco.雷尼尔国王是摩纳哥的君主。
prince among/of sth literary ■a man who is excellent at something 大王；巨擘；名家
•that prince of flautists, William Bennett那位长笛演奏名家威廉‧贝内特




n. 王子，国君；亲王；贵族
 - noble, infante
examples: 英 [prɪns] 美 [prɪns]
n.王子；亲王；诸侯

(1) The magician metamorphosed the frog into a prince.(2) The prince remained loyal throughout.(3) Prince Charles was invested as Prince of Wales in 1969.(4) His Highness Prince Charles will attend the meeting.(5) For all I do know he may be a prince in disguise.
(1) 魔术师把青蛙变成了王子。(2) 王子自始至终忠贞不渝。(3) 查尔斯王子於1969年受封为威尔士亲王。(4) 查尔斯亲王殿下将出席本次会议。(5) 从我所知道的一切来看，他可能是一个隐姓埋名的亲王。

translation:
n. 公主; 王妃（王族女性成员）; 女巨头，女名家; <古>女王

分布：公主(88%)，王妃(9%)，公爵夫人(2%)，贵妇(1%)


→来自prince,王子，-ess,表阴性。
n.公主,王妃Since then the sincere princess has known the principal principle.从那时起诚实的公主就知道该主要原理.



noun countable  IMPROVER  ■an important female member of a royal family, especially a daughter or granddaughter of a king and queen, or the wife of a prince （孙）公主；王妃；亲王夫人
•Lady Diana Spencer became Princess Diana when she married Prince Charles.戴安娜•斯宾塞女士在与查理斯王子结婚后成为戴安娜王妃。




n. 公主；王妃；女巨头

n.公主；王妃；贵妇；公爵夫人

(1) The magician transformed the frog into a princess.(2) The witch put the princess under a spell, and she fell asleep for ten years.(3) The kind dwarf asked the little princess to have dinner with him.(4) She performs the duties of a princess with great aplomb.(5) A footman came in to summon Boris to the princess.
(1) 魔术师把青蛙变成了公主。(2) 这女巫使公主中了巫术，沉睡了十年。(3) 善良的小矮人邀请小公主和他一起吃晚饭。(4) 她泰然自若地履行王妃的职责。(5) 仆役走来呼唤鲍里斯去见公爵夫人。

translation:
adj. 最重要的; 主要的; 资本的; 本金的
n. 首长，负责人; 主要演员，主角; [法]委托人，当事人; 本金

分布：校长(54%)，主要的(17%)，本金(11%)，委托人(6%)，首要的(3%)，主犯(3%)，主角(3%)，资本(3%)


→来自古法语principal,主要的，最重要的，来自拉丁语principalis,最重要的，来自princeps,国王，统治者，酋长，词源同prince.引申词义名词词义校长，院长等。
主要的;首要的(prin主要的＋cip+al)[cap,capt,cept,ceive,cip,cup=take,hold,seize,表示"拿,抓,握住"]
a.最重要的,主要的n.负责人,校长;资本,本金Since then the sincere princess has known the principal principle.从那时起诚实的公主就知道该主要原理.
【记】源于：prim（adj 最早的，最好的）【区】principle（n 法则；原则）【反】subordinate（adj 次要的）



adjective [before noun]  IMPROVER  ■first in order of importance 最重要的
•Iraq's principal export is oil.伊拉克最重要的出口商品是石油。

•He was principal dancer at the Dance Theatre of Harlem.他是哈莱姆舞剧院的头号舞伶。

•That was my principal reason for moving.那是我搬家最主要的原因。

['prɪnt.sɪ.pəl] noun PERSON  人  countable US ■the person in charge of a school or college for children aged between approximately 11 and 18 （中小学或学院的）校长
['prɪnt.sɪ.pəl] noun MONEY  金钱  countable usually singular specialized ■an amount of money which someone has invested in a bank or lent to a person or organization so that they will receive interest on it from the bank, person or organization 本金；可生息的资本
•She lives off the interest and tries to keep the principal intact.她靠利息过日子，尽量不动用本金。





president, principal, headmaster

这组词都有“校长”的意思，其区别是：
president: 在美国专指大学的校长，在英国指学院院长。
principal: 在英国可指大学校长、院长以及中小学校长，但在美国仅指中小学校长。
headmaster: 在英国指对中小学校长的一般称呼，尤指私立学校的校长。



principal, leading, primary, foremost, capital, major, chief, main

这组词都有“首要的，主要的”的意思，其区别是：
principal: 用于人时，指地位优于其他人；用于物时，指该物在大小、重要性等方面优于他物。
leading: 侧重指具有影响力或凝聚力。从而有主导和引导的作用。
primary: 通常不用于人。用于物时，指在重要性方面占第一位。
foremost: 侧重指在行进或发展过程中居首位。
capital: 着重指因重要性、意义、优越或重大而名列同类之首。
major: 指同其他人或其它物、问题等相比较，显得更加重要和突出。
chief: 拽人时，表同类中职位最高，权力最大；指物时，表同类中最重要，价值最高。
main: 通常只用于物。指在一定范围内，某物的重要性、体积或力量等超过其它物。


n. 校长；委托人，当事人；资本；主犯
 - president, client, party, headmaster
adj. 首要的；最重要的
 - supreme, main, lead
examples: [联想] principle 原则； principal 校长校长是本金的重要委托人
英 ['prɪnsəp(ə)l] 美 ['prɪnsəpl]
adj.主要的；首要的n.本金；资本；校长；主角；委托人；主犯

(1) Our principal problem is lack of time.(2) My wages are the principal source of my income.(3) My principal concern is my family's welfare.(4) How much interest will there be on a principal of $5000?(5) Mr.Charlie Wang is a Principal of Pangaea and responsible for capital management.(6) The principal or capital,as distinguished from the interest or income,as of a fund or estate.(7) When I came into the office, the principal rose to welcome me.(8) He is going to fill the position of principal.(9) She danced the principal role in the ballet.(10) Through it all Richard Nixon moved as if he were himself a spectator, not the principal.(11) The agent spoke on behalf of his principal.(12) I will have to consult my principals before I can give you an answer on that.(13) Indeed I was the principal in the crime.(14) Shall I work underground, bribing the paltry assistants in that foul conspiracy, until I find my way to the thrice guilty principal?

(1) 我们的主要问题就是缺少时间。(2) 薪金是我收入的主要来源。(3) 我至为关心的是我一家的幸福。(4) 5000美元本金的利息是多少？(5) 王岩先生现任磐石基金执行董事，负责资本管理。(6) 资金，基金或资产的本金或资本，以区别于利息或收入。(7) 当我走进办公室时,校长起身欢迎我。(8) 他将去担任中学校长的职务。(9) 她在这个芭蕾舞中担任主角。(10) 尼克松自始至终表现得象旁观者，而不是主角。(11) 代理人代表他的委托人说话。(12) 我必须同我的委托人磋商后才能就这个问题给你答复。(13) 我真正做了这个罪恶的主犯。(14) 我要不要秘密进行追究，贿赂那肮脏密谋中的可鄙助手，直至我找到线索挖出那三倍有罪的主犯？
[sound:youdao-4b1a1f77-2d26fec8-18c334eb-cb383ddc-fa3b7548.mp3]

translation:
n. 原则，原理; 准则，道义; 道德标准; 本能

分布：原则(56%)，原理(40%)，主义(3%)，信念(1%)


→来自principal,主要的，最重要的，-le,工具格后缀。引申词义原则，准则，规范等。
n.原理,原则;主义,信念Since then the sincere princess has known the principal principle.从那时起诚实的公主就知道该主要原理.



noun BASIC IDEA  基本思想   ESSENTIAL  countable ■a basic idea or rule that explains or controls how something happens or works 原理；原则
•the principles of the criminal justice system刑事审判制度的原则

•The country is run on socialist principles.这个国家推行社会主义制度。

•The machine works according to the principle of electromagnetic conduction.这台机器根据电磁传导原理运行。

•The organization works on the  principle  that all members have the same rights.该组织运作的原则是所有的成员都享有同等的权利。
⇒ See also first principlesin principle ■If you agree with or believe something in principle, you agree with the idea in general, although you might not support it in reality or in every situation 原则上，大体上，基本上
•In principle I agree with the idea, but in practice it's not always possible.我大致赞成这个想法，但实际上这并非总是可行。

•They have approved the changes in principle.他们基本上批准了这些变革。

['prɪnt.sɪ.pl] noun MORAL RULE  道德准则  countable or uncountable approving ■a moral rule or standard of good behaviour （行为）准则；道德；为人之道
•She doesn't have any principles.她毫无道德可言。

•He was a man of principle.他是个有道德准则的人。

•Anyway, I can't deceive him - it's against all my principles.无论如何，我不能欺骗他——这有悖于我做人的原则。

•I never gamble, as a matter of principle (= because I believe it is wrong).我从不赌博，对我来说这是个原则问题。

•She'd never ask to borrow money, on principle.按照她的处事原则，她从不向人借钱。





law, principle, theorem, fundamental

这组词都有“原理、原则”的意思，其区别是：
law: 指一直公认的。陈述各种现象的条理或关系的公理或定理等。
principle: 普通用词，含义广。指作判断的基础或行动的普通准则；也指自然科学的规律。
theorem: 多指经过推理或演算能得到证明的原理、定理或定律。
fundamental: 通常指原理、原则。



law, principle, rule, regulation

law: 指具体的法律，法规，法令
principle: 原理，原则，用作复数是指行为的准则，规范
rule: 规则，规章，惯常的做法，习惯
regulation: 通常用作复数，法规，条例


n. 原理，原则；主义，道义；本质，本义；根源，源泉
 - theory, mechanism, element, essence, parent
examples: 英 ['prɪnsəpl] 美 ['prɪnsəpl]
n.原理；原则；主义；信念

(1) A bicycle and a motorcycle are built on the same principle.(2) Archimedes ,a great physicist ,discovered the principle of floating bodies .(3) We adhere to the principle that everyone should be treated fairly.(4) It is easier to fight for one's principle than to live up to them.(5) He refused to attend the meeting on principle.
(1) 自行车和摩托车是根据同样的原理制造的。(2) 阿基米德，一位伟大的物理学家，发现了浮体原理。(3) 我们坚持人人都应该被平等对待这一原则。(4) 为自己的主义斗争，要比他们施诸实践更容易。(5) 他出于信念拒绝参加这次会议。
[sound:youdao-988412f9-f79e2046-4cda37b6-a9cce56d-6f922253.mp3]

translation:
n. （由底片印出的）照片; 印刷字体; 印痕; 印成的图画
vt. （在松软的表面）压印; 把…付印
vt. & vi. 用印刷体写; 冲洗（照片）; 登载; 在纸上印

时态：printed, printing, prints
分布：打印(68%)，印刷(20%)，出版(5%)，版画(2%)，印刷字体(1%)，印花(1%)，印记(1%)，铭刻(1%)，印刷的(1%)


→来自古法语preinte,按压，来自拉丁语premere,按，压，词源同press.-t,过去分词格。引申词义打印，印刷。
n.印刷,印刷品,字体v.印刷,出版;洗印I hint that the faint saint painted the printer with a pint of paint.我暗示说虚弱的圣徒用了一品脱油漆涂印刷机.



noun TEXT  文本   IMPROVER  uncountable ■letters, numbers, words or symbols that have been produced on paper by a machine using ink 印出的字体，印刷字体
•The title is in bold print.标题是粗体字。

•This novel is available in large print for readers with poor eyesight.这本小说有大字本，以满足视力差的读者的需要。

•The book was rushed into print (= was produced and published) as quickly as possible.这本书很快就印了出来。

•The print quality (= The quality of the text produced) of the new laser printer is excellent.这台新雷射印表机的列印品质很好。
 IMPROVER  uncountable ■newspapers, books and magazines 印刷品，出版物
•The debate is still raging, both in print and on the radio and television.这场争论仍然在报刊、电台、电视上激烈地进行着。
in/out of print ■If a book is in print, it is possible to buy a new copy of it, and if it is out of print, it is not now possible （书）仍可买到的／已绝版的
•Is her work still in print?她的书还能买得到吗？

•Classic literature never goes out of print.经典文学作品永远不会绝版。

[prɪnt] noun PICTURE  图片  countable ■a photographic copy of a painting, or a picture made by pressing paper onto a special surface covered in ink, or a single photograph from a film （用照相制版法制作的）绘画复制品；印出的版画；（底片洗出的单张）照片
•a print of Van Gogh's 'Sunflowers'梵谷作品《向日葵》的复制品

•a signed Hockney print附有霍克尼签名的复制画

•I'd like a second set of prints of this film, please.我还想再洗一套这卷底片的照片。

[prɪnt] noun PATTERN  图案  countable ■any type of pattern produced using ink on a piece of clothing （织品上的）印花
•a floral/paisley print花卉／佩斯利涡漩纹印花图案

[prɪnt] noun FINGER  手指  countable informal for ■fingerprint  
•The burglar had left his prints all over the window.窗户上到处都是窃贼留下的指纹。

[prɪnt] verb TEXT  文本   IMPROVER  intransitive or transitive ■to produce writing or images on paper or other material with a machine 印，印刷
•The leaflets will be printed on recycled paper.这些传单会用再生纸来印刷。

•I'm waiting for a document to print.我正在等文件印出来。
 IMPROVER  transitive ■to include a piece of writing in a newspaper or magazine （在报纸或杂志上）刊登，刊载
•Some newspapers still refuse to print certain swear words.有些报纸仍然拒绝某些脏话见报。

•They printed his letter in Tuesday's paper.他们在星期二的报纸上刊载了他的信。
 IMPROVER  transitive ■to produce a newspaper, magazine or book in large quantities （大量）出版发行
•20 000 copies of the novel will be printed in hardback.这本小说将以精装本的形式发行两万册。

[prɪnt] verb WRITE  写  intransitive or transitive ■to write without joining the letters together 用印刷体写
•Please print your name clearly below your signature.请用印刷体在签名下方把你的名字写清楚。

[prɪnt] verb PICTURE  图片  transitive ■to produce a photograph on paper 冲印
•Photographs are better if they are printed from the original negative.照片要是用原始底片冲洗，效果会更好。

[prɪnt] verb PATTERN  图案  transitive ■to produce a pattern on material or paper 印花样于
•The designs are printed onto the fabric by hand.这些图案是手工印在织品上的。

[prɪnt] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] print sth out ■to produce a printed copy of a document that has been written on a computer （从电脑）列印出
•Could you print out a copy of that letter for me?你能把那封信列印一份给我吗？




n. [印刷] 印刷业；印花布；印刷字体；印章；印记
 - impression, seal
vt. [印刷] 印刷； [计] 打印；刊载；用印刷体写；在…印花样
 - strike off
vi. [印刷] 印刷；出版；用印刷体写
 - bring out, get out
examples: 英 [prɪnt] 美 [prɪnt]
v.印刷；出版；打印；铭刻n.印刷字体；版画；印刷；印记；印刷物；印花adj.印刷的

(1) How many copies shall we print from the negative?(2) His second book is already in print.(3) He founded his own press to print them.(4) This printer can print 40 pages in a minute.(5) During that time, the radiation diffused across short distance scales, smearing the fine print in the microwave background sky.(6) The print is too small for me to read without glasses.(7) The printmaking would lose direction if print artists have no skill interests in creation.(8) This boundary is like the outer circumference of the Escher print or the surface of the solid cylinder I considered earlier.(9) Her first novel is out of print now but you may find a second-hand copy.(10) The thief had left his prints on the handle.(11) He assures to us that we will get the blue print in time.(12) The sofa was adorned with a gay print slipcover.(13) He was standing in his print shirt and his waistcoat in front of his shop, which looked into the street.He saw Alpatitch, and went up to him.(14) Headlines are written in large print.(15) I closed up the space between the lines of print.

(1) 用这张底片我们要印多少张相片?(2) 他的第二本书已出版。(3) 他自己成立印刷厂出版这些书。(4) 这台打印机一分钟能打印40页。(5) 在这期间，辐射在短距离尺度上四处漫射，模糊了铭刻在微波背景天空上的细微印记。(6) 印刷字体太小，我不带眼镜就看不清。(7) 版画家脱离技术趣味进行创作时，版画创作就没有了方向感。(8) 这个边界就类似艾雪版画的外缘或者前面提过的圆柱体的表面。(9) 她的第一部小说现已绝版，不过你可以找本旧的。(10) 小偷在把手上留下了指纹。(11) 他向我们保证我们将及时得到蓝图。(12) 沙发上罩了一个鲜艳的印花套子。(13) 身穿背心和印花衬衫的费拉蓬托夫，站在面临大街的面粉店的傍边，他看见了阿尔帕特奇，便向他走过去。(14) 标题是用大号字体印刷的。(15) 我使印刷的行距靠紧些。

translation:
adj. 优先的; 占先的; 在…之前
n. 小修道院院长，大修道院的副院长; （隐修院）会长; [史]行政长官; 普赖尔
adv. 在前; 居先

分布：优先的(31%)，在前的(23%)，更重要的(17%)，在前(17%)，居先(12%)


→来自拉丁语prior,先前的，领先的，来自古拉丁语pri,在前，先于，来自per,向前，词源同ford,first.-or,比较级后缀。后用于小隐修院院长尊称。
a.优先的,在前的;(to)在...之前I've hatred for the hateful man's skates bought with prior private privilege.我对那个可恶男子用优先个人特权购买的冰鞋感到厌恶.



US [praɪr] adjective [before noun] EARLIER  早些的   IMPROVER  slightly formal ■existing or happening before something else, or before a particular time 在先的，在前的；居先的
•The course required no prior knowledge of Spanish.这门课不要求先前学过西班牙语。

•They had to refuse the dinner invitation because of a prior engagement (= something already planned for that time).因为事先另有约会，他们只好拒绝了吃饭的邀请。
prior to sth ■before a particular time or event 在…之前
•the weeks prior to her death她死之前的几个星期

UK [praɪər] US [praɪr] adjective [before noun] MORE IMPORTANT  更重要的  formal ■more important 更重要的；优先的
•Mothers with young children have a prior claim on funds.抚育幼儿的母亲拥有优先获得补助的权利。

UK [praɪər] US [praɪr] noun countable ■a man who is in charge of a priory or who is second in charge of an abbey 小修道院长；修道院副院长




previous, preceding, former, foregoing, prior

这组词都有“在前的”的意思，其区别是：
previous: 指时间上、顺序上较早的，或指正在谈论的某事的前一个。
preceding: 特指时间和地位上紧接在前。
former: 系latter的反义词，比prior更着重对比。
foregoing: 指前所述的，是following的反义词。
prior: 与previous同义，常可换用，但prior有时强调更大的重要性，对比意味强。


adj. [数] 优先的；在先的，在前的
 - preferred, underlying
adv. 在前，居先
 - before, antecedently
examples: 英 ['praɪə(r)] 美 ['praɪər]
adj.优先的；在前的；更重要的adv.居先；在前

(1) He feels a prior obligation to his job as a journalist.(2) Generally speaking, individuals who first appropriate part of a water supply have prior claim over those whose appropriation is later in time.(3) The offer is subject to prior sale.(4) His answer was tinted by his prior knowledge.(5) This task is prior to all others.(6) Constitution is prior to all other laws.(7) The golden octave holds within it all of the prior eight vibrations or planes within its field.
(1) 他觉得要优先为他的新闻记者的工作尽职。(2) 一般来说，先使用水资源的人比后使用者拥有更优先的权利。(3) 该报盘以未售出前为准。(4) 他的回答说明他先前就有所了解。(5) 这项任务比所有其他任务都重要。(6) 宪法比其他一切法律都重要。(7) 金色音阶内掌握着所有在前的八度音阶或它场内所有的层面。
[sound:youdao-9838e23c-3bae7118-5f73cc16-3cd6eb00-d5d95b0b.mp3]

translation:
n. 监狱; 牢笼; 监禁; 入狱

分布：监狱(80%)，监禁(17%)，囚禁(2%)，关入监狱(1%)


→来自古法语prison,监狱，来自拉丁语prehensionem,抓住，来自prehendere,抓住，握住，词源同prehensile,comprehend.-s,过去分词格。引申动词词义监禁，关押。
监狱(抓人之地)[pris=take表示"拿住,抓住"]
n.监狱The newly imprisoned prisoners poisoned poisonous moisture are hoisted out from the prison.中了有毒湿气毒的新近关押的囚犯被从监狱吊出.



noun  ESSENTIAL  countable or uncountable ■a building where criminals are forced to live as a punishment 监狱
•Conditions in the prison are said to be appalling.听说监狱里的条件糟透了。

•He's spent a lot of time in prison.他坐了很长时间的牢。

•She went to/was sent to prison for six months.她入狱六个月。

•It was a maximum-security prison (= intended to be especially difficult to escape from).这是一所戒备森严的监狱。

•They should put him in prison and throw away the key!他们应该把他关进监狱，永远也别放出来！

•a prison cell/sentence/warder牢房／徒刑／狱吏
 ADVANCED  uncountable ■the system of keeping people in prisons 监禁，关押；关押制度
•the prison service服刑

•Do you think prison works?你认为监禁有用吗？

•Prison (= the time he had spent in prison) hadn't changed him at all.服刑对他丝毫没有改变。
countable ■a situation or relationship from which it is difficult to escape 牢笼；禁锢
•She felt that her marriage had become a prison.她觉得自己的婚姻变成了牢笼。





prison, cell, jail

这组词都有“牢房，监狱”的意思，其区别是：
prison: 指触犯刑律的人被关押的地方，通常指判决后的罪犯居留地。
cell: 指单人牢房或几个人合住的小牢房。
jail: (英国英语拼写为gaol)指收犯轻罪的人或未经判决的人的处所。


n. [法] 监狱；监禁；拘留所
 - jail, big house
vt. 监禁，关押
 - imprison, jail
examples: 英 ['prɪzn] 美 ['prɪzn]
n.监狱；监禁vt.囚禁；关入监狱

(1) The police crushed out the rebellion in the prison.(2) That felon tried to escape from the prison.(3) His deliverance from the prison puzzled us.(4) Strikes by prison officers underline the need for reform in our gaols.(5) The thief was put into prison for one year.(6) Many people believe that prison isn't a cure for crime.(7) She continues to languish in a foreign prison.(8) He has been kept in prison for weeks without food and dies like a dog.
(1) 警察把发生在监狱中的暴乱镇压了下去。(2) 那名重罪犯试图从监狱中逃跑。(3) 他被从监狱释放使我们困惑不已。(4) 监狱工作人员罢工一事，突出地表明我们的监狱制度需要改革。(5) 小偷被监禁一年。(6) 许多人都相信监禁解决不了犯罪问题。(7) 她被继续囚禁在一所外国的监狱里。(8) 他被囚禁了几星期，没有食物果腹，最後悲惨地死去。
[sound:youdao-48a5e082-7f8806f1-7419c8bd-a7ffff85-4f6ebb56.mp3]

translation:
n. 囚犯; 犯人; 俘虏; 刑事被告

分布：囚犯(100%)


n.囚犯The newly imprisoned prisoners poisoned poisonous moisture are hoisted out from the prison.中了有毒湿气毒的新近关押的囚犯被从监狱吊出.



US [-ɚ] noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a person who is kept in prison as a punishment 犯人，囚犯
•Prisoners climbed onto the prison roof to protest at the conditions inside the prison.犯人们爬上监狱屋顶对监狱里的条件环境表示抗议。
⇒ See also political prisonerhold/keep/take sb prisoner ■to catch someone and guard them so that they cannot escape 监禁，拘押（某人）
•Of 10 000 troops, 7000 were killed, wounded or taken prisoner.1万人的军队中，有7000人阵亡、受伤或被俘。

•The pilot and several passengers were held prisoner by the gunmen for 57 hours.飞行员和几名乘客被持枪歹徒扣押了57个小时。

UK ['prɪz.ən.ər] US [-ɚ] noun countable take no prisoners ■If someone takes no prisoners, when they try to achieve something they are very determined and do not care about other people's feelings 格杀勿论（take no prisoners 是“格杀勿论”，意思是不要俘虏、统统杀掉。如果某人“格杀勿论”，那么他们企图获得某物时就会非常坚定，不在乎其他人的感受）
•When Eric's anger is aroused, he takes no prisoners.当埃里克被激怒时，他就会对别人的感受毫不理会。





convict, captive, prisoner

这组词都有“囚犯、俘虏”的意思，其区别是：
convict: 指经判决而在狱中服刑的人。
captive: 指战争中抓到的俘虏，也可作引申用。
prisoner: 指关入监狱的囚犯，包括战俘，也可作引申用。


n. 囚犯，犯人；俘虏；刑事被告
 - capture, galley slave
examples: 英 ['prɪznə(r)] 美 ['prɪznər]
n.囚犯
(1) The prisoner made a plea for mercy.
(1) 囚犯恳求宽恕。
[sound:youdao-51bcfaac-521a6fed-f76db48f-c8d28449-11f2e3f6.mp3]

translation:
adj. 私有的，私人的; 秘密的; 内心的; 平民的，无官职的，士兵的
n. 列兵，士兵，[陆]二等兵; 〈古〉私人，个人; 阴部，生殖器

分布：私人的(33%)，私有的(17%)，个人的(17%)，列兵(12%)，士兵(10%)，私下的(10%)，缄默的(1%)


→来自拉丁语privare,使个人化，使分开，使剥离，来自privus,个人的，自己的，来自per,向前，穿过，词源同ford,first.
私人的(priv+ate→个人的)[Priv=single,lone,表示"单个"]
a.私人的,个人的,秘密的,私下的I've hatred for the hateful man's skates bought with prior private privilege.我对那个可恶男子用优先个人特权购买的冰鞋感到厌恶.



adjective PERSONAL  私人的   ESSENTIAL  ■only for one person or group and not for everyone 私人（用）的；私有的
•She has a small office which is used for private discussions.她有一间小办公室，做密谈之用。

•I caught him looking through my private papers.我撞见他在翻阅我的私人文件。

•The sign on the gate said 'Private Property - No Admittance.'大门的标牌上写著「私宅——闲人莫入”。
 ESSENTIAL  ■describes activities which involve personal matters or relationships and are not connected with your work 私人的
•Apparently in interviews he refuses to talk about his private life.很明显，他在采访中不愿谈论自己的私生活。
■describes thoughts and opinions which are secret and which you do not discuss with other people 不公开的，秘密的
•Although I support the project in public, my private opinion is that it will fail.虽然我当众支持这项计划，但我私底下认为它不会成功。

•This is a private matter.这是私事。
■describes a place which is quiet and where there are no other people to see or hear you （场所）清静的，不受侵扰的
•Is there somewhere private where we can talk?有没有一个安静的地方好让我们谈一谈？
■describes someone who does not like to talk about their personal feelings and thoughts 不愿吐露心思的；不爱交流思想的；内向的
•She's quite a private person.她是一个很内向的人。
in private ■If you talk to someone or do something in private, you do it without other people being present 非公开的，私下的
•Jamie wants to speak to me in private.杰米想和我私下谈谈。
 Compare in public at public
['praɪ.vət] adjective NOT OFFICIAL  非官方的   ESSENTIAL  ■controlled or paid for by a person or company and not by the government 私立的；私营的；民间的
•private education/healthcare私立教育／医疗保健

•a private doctor/dentist私人医生／牙医

•Banks should be supporting small private businesses.银行应该支持小型私人企业。

['praɪ.vət] noun countable ■a soldier of the lowest rank in an army 二等兵，列兵




personal, individual, private

这组词都有“个人的，私人的”的意思，其区别是：
personal: 指属于或关于某人或某些特定的人，以区别于其他人。
individual: 与集体的相对，指个别或个体的。
private: 指属于私人所有或具有私营性质，以区别于集体或公共的，有时含不公开的意味。


adj. 私人的；私有的；私下的
 - chamber, cabinet
n. 列兵；二等兵
 - seaman second class
examples: 英 ['praɪvət] 美 ['praɪvət]
adj.私人的；个人的；私下的；私有的；缄默的n.士兵；列兵

(1) The president is paying a private visit to Europe.(2) We each have our private views about it.(3) The public is fascinated by the private lives of public figures.(4) She is a very retiring and private person.(5) Dr.Kraemer,a former lawyer,was also a private in World WarⅠ.(6) Soldiers are classified as Private, Specialist Sergeant and Master Sergeant.
(1) 总统正在欧洲进行私人访问。(2) 我们每个人对这件事都有自己的看法。(3) 公众对社会名流的私生活具有浓厚的兴趣。(4) 她是个非常孤独缄默的人。(5) 克雷默博士以前当过律师,一战时也是个士兵。(6) 士兵分为列兵、专业军士、军士长。
[sound:youdao-b32689a1-c0169e68-6b317337-1e2f3c3b-e654aef8.mp3]

translation:
n. 特权; （因财富和社会地位而仅有部分人享有的）权益; 免责特权; 特殊荣幸
vt. 给与…特权，特免

时态：privileged, privileging, privileges
分布：特权(80%)，荣幸(17%)，免除(1%)，给特权(1%)，特别恩典(1%)


→来自拉丁语privilegium,私人法律，特权，来自privus,个人的，词源同private,-leg,法律，词源同legal.
特权(privi+lege法律→有个人法律→特权)[Priv=single,lone,表示"单个"]
n.特权,优惠,特许v.给予优惠,给予特权I've hatred for the hateful man's skates bought with prior private privilege.我对那个可恶男子用优先个人特权购买的冰鞋感到厌恶.
【记】pri＝private（adj 私人的），vilege＝village（n 乡村）：有私人的村庄－特权



noun  ADVANCED  countable or uncountable ■an advantage that only one person or group of people has, usually because of their position or because they are rich （特定个体或群体的）特权，特别待遇
•Healthcare should be a right, not a privilege.医疗保健应该是权利，而非特权。

•Senior management enjoy certain privileges, such as company cars and private healthcare.高级管理阶层享受公司配车和私人医疗保健等特权。
 ADVANCED  only singular ■an opportunity to do something special or enjoyable 荣幸
•I had the privilege of interviewing Picasso in the 1960s.我在20世纪60年代很荣幸地采访到了毕卡索。

•It was a real privilege to meet her.见到她真是莫大的荣幸。
uncountable ■the way in which rich people or people from a high social class have most of the advantages in society （富人或有权势者的）特权，特别待遇
•a life of privilege特权生活
countable or uncountable specialized ■the special right that some people in authority have which allows them to do or say things that other people are not allowed to 特权；特免
•diplomatic/parliamentary privilege外交／议会言论特权





privilege, power, right

privilege: 特权
power: 力量，权力
right: 权利


n. [计] 特权；优待；基本权利
 - franchise, peculiar
examples: 英 ['prɪvəlɪdʒ] 美 ['prɪvəlɪdʒ]
n.特权；荣幸；特别恩典；基本人权vt.给特权；免除
(1) I had the privilege of meeting the queen.(2) It is a great privilege to know you.(3) It was a privilege to work with him.(4) Kings cannot privilege what God forbade.
(1) 我有会见王后的特权。(2) 认识你是一件难得的事。(3) 和他在一起工作是一项殊荣。(4) 国王不能原谅上帝不允许做的事。
[sound:youdao-e5ab4f0d-0d53e179-c8067673-21f9f6f7-849fffe2.mp3]

translation:
n. 奖赏; 战利品; 值得努力争取的东西
vt. 珍视，珍惜; 估价
adj. 获奖的，有望获奖的; 理应获奖的

时态：prized, prizing, prizes
分布：奖品(32%)，奖金(24%)，奖赏(17%)，珍视(10%)，得奖的(8%)，估价(7%)，奖品的(1%)，一流的(1%)


→来自古法语pris,价格，价值，奖品，词源同price,praise.prize 撬开
n.奖赏,奖金,奖品v.珍视,珍惜I recognized the large-sized prize and seized it.我认出了大号奖品并将它占有.



noun countable  ADVANCED  ■something valuable, such as an amount of money, that is given to someone who succeeds in a competition or game or that is given to someone as a reward for doing very good work 奖；奖赏；奖金
•The critics' prize for best film was won by Marc Abbott for 'Belly Laugh'.马克•阿博特的《捧腹大笑》被评论家们评为最佳影片。

•I won a prize in the raffle.我在摸彩中获了奖。

•The first (= main) prize is a weekend for two in Bruges.头奖是布鲁日双人周末游。

•The prize money for literary competitions can be as high as £40 000.文学创作竞赛的奖金可能高达四万英镑。
■something important and valuable which is difficult to achieve or get 难能可贵的东西；不易达到的目标
•The prize would be her hand in marriage.最理想的是娶她为妻。

[praɪz] noun countable no prizes for guessing sth ■something you say when it is very easy to guess something …太容易猜了；不用猜都知道…
•No prizes for guessing where Daniel is.不用猜都知道丹尼尔在哪里。

[praɪz] verb LIFT  举起  (ALSO UK also prise) transitive + adverb or preposition ■to move or lift something by pressing a tool against a fixed point 撬，撬开
•I prized the lid off with a spoon.我用杓子把盖子撬掉了。

•The window had been prized open with a jemmy.窗户被用撬棍撬开了。

[praɪz] verb REWARD  奖赏  transitive often passive ■to think that someone or something is very valuable or important 重视，珍视
•In parts of Asia this plant is prized for its medicinal qualities.在亚洲某些地区，这种植物因其药用价值而倍受重视。

•I prize that intimacy above everything.我把那种亲密关系看得比甚么都重。

[praɪz] verb   Phrasal Verbs   prize sth out of sb ■to get something from someone with difficulty, especially information or money （费力地）从（某人）那里获得（尤指消息或金钱）
•He's so secretive - you'll have a hard time prizing any information out of him.他如此守口如瓶——你要从他那打听情况会很困难。

[praɪz] adjective [before noun] ■A prize animal, flower or vegetable is one that has won or deserves to win a prize in a competition because it is of very good quality （指动物、花或蔬菜）得奖的；该得奖的；一流的
•a prize bull一流的公牛

•a prize marrow上好的西葫芦
■describes something which is a very good or important example of its type （指某物）极好的；极重要的
•prize assets重要资产

•slightly old-fashioned Some prize idiot (= extremely foolish person) forgot to lock the door.有个大傻瓜忘了锁门。





price, prize

price: 价格, The price is high/low.
prize: 奖,奖品,奖金 win the first prize


n. [劳经] 奖品；奖赏；战利品
 - award, capture
vt. 珍视；捕获；估价
 - assess, acquire, evaluate, value, rate
examples: 英 [praɪz] 美 [praɪz]
n.奖品；奖金；奖赏vt.珍视；估价adj.奖品的；得奖的；一流的

(1) The boys competed with each other for the prize.(2) First prize in the raffle is a holiday for two in Paris.(3) The champion team will win the cup and prize.(4) They all concurred in giving him the prize.(5) He was awarded a prize for excellence in his studies.(6) She will use the prize money to help pay for my education.(7) She is the most likely girl to win the prize.(8) The cowboy led in his prize winning Bull.(9) She always makes a mess of things; she's a prize idiot.
(1) 那些男孩子为赢得奖品而互相竞争。(2) 抽奖销售的头奖是两个人到巴黎度假旅游。(3) 比赛的冠军将获得奖杯和奖金。(4) 他们一致同意给他奖赏。(5) 他因学习成绩优秀而受到奖赏。(6) 她要用这笔奖金支付部分学费。(7) 她是最有希望得奖的女孩。(8) 牛仔把他得奖的公牛引导入内。(9) 她总是把事情弄糟; 她是个不折不扣的大笨蛋。
[sound:youdao-e103d752-b2d299b9-e8af3ae1-44a11e4e-d0661a78.mp3]

translation:
n. 可能性; 几率，概率; 或然性

分布：可能性(80%)，机率(20%)


→来自probable,可能的，-ity,名词后缀。引申词义概率。
可能性(probable+ility)[prob,prov=test表示"测试,证明"]
n.可能性,或然性,概率There is every probability of his coming.他多半会来.



US [ˌprɑ:.bə'bɪl.ə.tˌi] noun countable or uncountable  ADVANCED  ■the level of possibility of something happening or being true; likelihood  可能性
•What is the probability of winning ?获胜的可能性有多大？

•The probability of getting all the answers correct is about one in ten.答案全部正确的可能性大约是1／10

•There's a high/strong  probability (that) (= It is very likely that) she'll be here.她很可能会来。

•Until yesterday, the project was just a possibility, but now it has become a real probability (= it is likely that it will happen).到昨天为止这项计划还只是可能，但现在看来真的会实现。
in all probability ■used to mean that something is very likely 很有可能，十之八九
•She will, in all probability, have left before we arrive.她十之八九会在我们到达之前就已经离开了。




n. 可能性；机率； [数] 或然率
 - possibility, feasibility, potential, maybe, chance
examples: 英 [ˌprɒbə'bɪləti] 美 [ˌprɑːbə'bɪləti]
n.可能性；【数】或然率；机率；【统计】概率，概率论

(1) The probability that it will rain today is high.(2) The probability of making a mistake increases when you are tired.(3) Sometimes, love is a kind of probability.(4) I don't know how to calculate probability accurately.(5) The probability of owning a house rises with the number of old people living in the household.
(1) 今天下雨的可能性很大。(2) 你累的时候犯错误的可能性就会增加。(3) 有时，爱情就是一种或然率。(4) 不知道怎样才可以准确的计算出或然率。(5) 户内非经济户长之老年人口数则对于拥有自住房屋的机率有正的影响。
[sound:youdao-f0cdc942-09945b6e-856aed40-27c2d904-12d295ce.mp3]

translation:
adj. 可能的; 大概的
n. 很可能的事; 可能入选者

分布：很可能的(60%)，很可能的事(40%)


→来自拉丁语probare,检验，证实，词源同prove,probe.引申词义可检验的，可能的。
可能的(prob+able→能证明的→可能的)[prob,prov=test表示"测试,证明"]
a.很可能的,大概的;有希望的,可能的It is probable that he has forgotten our appointment.很可能他是忘了我们的约会了.



US ['prɑ:.bə-] adjective  ADVANCED  ■likely to be true or likely to happen 很可能真实的；很可能发生的
•The probable cause of death was heart failure.死因很可能是心脏衰竭。

•An election in June seems increasingly probable.六月举行选举的可能性似乎越来越大了。

•[+ that] It is probable that share prices will fall still further.股价很可能进一步下跌。
 Compare possible  Opposite improbable




possible, probable, likely

possible: 强调客观上可能性，但常带有“实际可能性很小”的暗示。如：It’s possible, though not probable, that he will accept these terms. (他有可能接受这些条件，但希望很小。)
probable: 很可能的，大概的，语气较possible强。如：It is probable that the cost will be greater than we think.(花费很可能比我们料想的要多。)
likely: 暗示从表面迹象来判断“有可能的”。如：It is likely that he will come.(他多半会来。)


adj. 很可能的；可信的
 - likely, trusted, authentic
examples: 英 ['prɒbəbl] 美 ['prɑːbəbl]
adj.很可能的n.很可能的事

(1) The most probable discipline for its use is chemical engineering, but it can also be used in materials science, fuels science, and chemistry programs.(2) The most probable discipline for its use is chemical engineering, but it can also be used in materials science, fuels science, and chemistry programs.
(1) 它的使用的最很可能的纪律是化学工程，但是它也能被在材料科学，燃料科学和化学计画方面使用。(2) 它的使用的最很可能的纪律是化学工程，但是它也能被在材料科学，燃料科学和化学计画方面使用。

translation:
n. 问题; 疑难问题; 习题; 引起麻烦的人
adj. 成问题的; 难处理的; 关于社会问题的

分布：问题(92%)，难题(5%)，习题(1%)，成问题的(1%)，难对付的(1%)


→来自希腊语problema,难题，问题，来自proballein,扔在前面，提出难题，来自pro-,向前，-ball,扔，投掷，词源同ballistic,parable.
n.问题,疑难问题;思考题,讨论题It's resolved by resolution that the solution will be used to solve the involved problem.决议决定用这个办法解决那个复杂的问题.



US ['prɑ:.bləm] noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a situation, person or thing that needs attention and needs to be dealt with or solved （须解决的）问题；疑难问题，困难
•financial/health problems财政／健康问题

•Our main problem is lack of cash.我们的主要问题是缺乏现金。

•I'm having problems with my computer.我的电脑出了故障。

•No one has solved the problem of what to do with radioactive waste.还没有人能解决如何处理放射性废物这个难题。

•The very high rate of inflation poses/presents (= is) a serious problem for the government.高通货膨胀率对政府来说是个严重的问题。

•When is the government going to tackle (= deal with) the problem of poverty in the inner cities?政府打算甚么时候才要解决旧城区的贫困问题？

•[+ -ing verb] Did you have any problems (= difficulties) getting here?你到这里来有甚么困难吗？

•I'd love to come - the only  problem is I've got friends staying that night.我很想来——只是那天晚上我有朋友在。
■a question in mathematics which needs an answer 数学习题，数学问题
•We were given ten problems to solve.我们有十道问题要做。
problem child/family, etc. ■a child, etc. whose behaviour is bad 问题儿童／家庭等
UK ['prɒb.ləm] US ['prɑ:.bləm] noun countable have a problem with sth/sb informal ■to find something or someone annoying or offensive 认为…令人讨厌（或无礼）
•I have a real problem with people who use their mobile phones on the train.我对那些在火车上打手机的人非常反感。

•She can smoke - I don't have a problem with that.她可以抽烟——我没意见。

UK ['prɒb.ləm] US ['prɑ:.bləm] noun countable No problem. informal  ADVANCED  ■said to show that you will or can do what someone has asked you to 没问题
•"Can you get me to the station by 11.30?" "No problem."“你能在11点半之前送我到车站吗？”“没问题。”
 ADVANCED  ■used as a friendly answer when someone thanks you for something you have done （用于回答对方的感谢）没甚么
•"Thanks for the lift." "No problem."“谢谢你让我搭便车。”“没甚么。”

UK ['prɒb.ləm] US ['prɑ:.bləm] noun countable   Common Learner Errors   problemWhen problem  is followed by a verb, that verb should be in the -ing form.Do not say 'have problems to do something', say have problems doing something.✗ I had problems to learn English before I came to England.I had problems learning English before I came to England.




puzzle, mystery, riddle, problem

这组词都有“谜、难题”的意思，其区别是：
puzzle: 语气较强，指复杂令人费解的情况或问题。
mystery: 指常人难以认识其起因或性质的奥秘，或指有意不让人理解的奥妙。
riddle: 指供人猜的谜语游戏，也可指终究会有解答的难题。
problem: 指有待探讨的疑难问题，也可指令人困惑的情况。



matter, issue, problem, question

这组词都有“问题”的意思，其区别是：
matter: 含义不很具体，暗示人们考虑和关心的事和话题。
issue: 多指意见能达到一致的问题，着重争论或讨论中的问题。
problem: 指客观上存在的、难以处理或难以理解的问题。
question: 通常指用口头或书面提出来要求回答或有待讨论解决的问题。


n. 难题；引起麻烦的人
 - conundrum, puzzler
adj. 成问题的；难处理的
 - debatable, stubborn
examples: 英 ['prɒbləm] 美 ['prɑːbləm]
n.问题；难题；习题adj.成问题的；难对付的

(1) That's your problem.(2) We had no time to deliberate on the problem.(3) The problem is when to get the money we need.(4) Heavy traffic poses a problem in many old towns.(5) The students are working on a mathematical problem.
(1) 那是你的问题。(2) 我们没有时间仔细思考这个问题.(3) 问题是什么时候能得到我们所需要的钱。(4) 交通拥挤是许多旧城镇的难题。(5) 学生们正在解一道数学习题。
[sound:youdao-93d5ec47-4f504236-8b25f4dd-b46a7cb1-c79a48f8.mp3]

translation:
n. 程序，手续; 工序，过程，步骤; 诉讼程序，（议会的）议事程序; 〈罕〉进行

分布：程序(67%)，步骤(18%)，手续(15%)


→来自proceed,行进，前进。引申词义程序，步骤。
程序;手续(pro在前＋ced+ure→在前面走完的程序)[ced,ceed,cess=go,表示"行走,前进"]
n.程序,手续,步骤During the procession, the microprocessor finished the processing procedure.在队伍行进时,微处理器完成了加工过程.



US [-dʒɚ] noun WAY TO DO  程式   IMPROVER  countable or uncountable ■a set of actions which is the official or accepted way of doing something 程式；步骤；常规
•The company has new procedures for dealing with complaints.公司采取了新的处理投诉事宜的程式。

•You must follow correct procedure at all times.你必须随时按照正确的步骤操作。

UK [prə'si:.dʒər] US [-dʒɚ] noun MEDICAL TREATMENT  医疗处理   ADVANCED  countable ■a medical operation 医疗处理；手术
•It's a routine/standard surgical procedure.这是一个普通的外科手术。

UK [prə'si:.dʒər] US [-dʒɚ] noun COMPUTING  电脑  countable specialized ■in computing, part of a program which performs a particular job and which is operated by the main part of the program when it is needed （电脑的）应用程式



n. 程序， [管理] 手续；步骤
 - routine, program, move, step
examples: 英 [prə'siːdʒə(r)] 美 [prə'siːdʒər]
n.程序；手续；步骤
(1) These procedures are highly irregular.(2) What's the procedure for opening a savings account?(3) The next procedure is to insert the battery.
(1) 这些程序是很不合乎规则的。(2) 开一个储蓄帐户有什么手续?(3) 接下来的步骤是装进电池。
[sound:youdao-f684b5af-b562de17-82171e22-95b6d0c0-dd03ba18.mp3]

translation:
vi. 进行; 前进; （沿特定路线）行进; （尤指打断后）继续说
n. 收入，获利

时态：proceeded, proceeding, proceeds
分布：继续进行(54%)，开始(33%)，着手(13%)


→pro-,向前，-ceed,走，词源同accede,concede.引申诸相关词义。
继续进行,前进(pro向前＋ceed→向前走→前进)[ced,ceed,cess=go,表示"行走,前进"]
v.进行,继续下去;发生After stopping to rest, they proceeded up the hill.停下来休息以后,他们又继续上山.



US [proʊ-] verb intransitive  IMPROVER  slightly formal ■to continue as planned 继续进行，继续做
•His lawyers have decided not to proceed with the case.他的律师已经决定不再继续打那场官司了。

•Preparations for the festival are now proceeding smoothly.艺术节的准备活动正在顺利进行中。
proceed to do sth ■to do something after you have done something else （做完某事后）接着做
•She sat down and proceeded to tell me about her skiing holiday.她坐了下来，接着告诉我有关她滑雪度假的事情。

•humorous He told me he was on a diet and then proceeded to eat a plateful of chips!他告诉我他在节食，接着就吃了满满的一盘炸薯条！
■formal ■to move forward or travel in a particular direction （朝特定方向）前进
•Passengers for Madrid should proceed to gate 26 for boarding.前往马德里的乘客应到26号登机门准备登机。

UK [prəʊ'si:d] US [proʊ-] verb intransitive   Phrasal Verbs   proceed against sb legal ■to start to take legal action against someone 起诉（某人），对（某人）提起诉讼
•Lack of evidence meant that the Council could not proceed against Mr Naylor.证据不足意味着市议会不能起诉内勒先生。





peogress, proceed, advance

这组词都有“前进”的意思，其区别是：
peogress: 多表自然过程，指生长，发展等稳定地或循环往复地前进。如：The year is progressing, it will soon be summer. (光阴似箭，很快又是夏天了。)
proceed: 强调从一处向另一处的运动，常表停顿后继续前进。如：They proceeded from London to Paris. (他们从伦敦往巴黎前进。)
advance: 表向一个特定的目的地，在一定的时间或空间内稳定地向前运动。如：Napoleon’s army advanced on Moscow. (拿破仑的军队向莫斯科挺进。)



advance, progress, proceed, move on, go

这些动词均含“前进，行进，进展”之意。
advance: 主要用于具体的人或物，也可指科学技术和运动等。
progress: 指按某一既定目标前进，取得发展，目的性很明确，强调经常和稳定地前进。
proceed: 侧重指继续前进。
move on: 非正式用语，侧重从某一停止点向某地前进，但不表示前进的目的地。
go: 最常用词，含义宽泛而不确切，依上文确定其具体意思。


vi. 开始；继续进行；发生；行进
 - occur, happen, travel, pursue
examples: 英 [prə'siːd] 美 [proʊ'siːd]
vi.继续进行；开始；着手

(1) We received sanction to proceed with our plans.(2) Please go upstairs and proceed through the security check and immigration.(3) Please proceed with your presentation.(4) After everyone was seated the chairman proceeded to announce his plan.(5) He also gave me sound advice on how to proceed with my inquiries.
(1) 我们获准继续进行我们的计划。(2) 请您到楼上继续进行安全检查和移民检查。(3) 请开始你的简报。(4) 大家就坐后，主席开始宣布他的计划。(5) 关于如何着手我的调查，他还提了很好的忠告。
[sound:youdao-d77cdf8e-a0cb5fe6-dd7bf8f3-d3238319-7cfc256b.mp3]

translation:
n. 过程; 工序; 做事方法; 工艺流程
vt. 加工; 处理; 审阅; 审核
vi. 列队行进
adj. 经过特殊加工（或处理）的

时态：processed, processing, processes
分布：过程(58%)，处理(33%)，加工(7%)，工序(1%)，列队前进(1%)


→来自proceed,行进，进行，-ss,过去分词格。词性由形容词转名词及动词，引申诸相关比喻义。
过程;进行[ced,ceed,cess=go,表示"行走,前进"]
n.过程,进程;工序,制作法;工艺v.加工,处理During the procession, the microprocessor finished the processing procedure.在队伍行进时,微处理器完成了加工过程.



US [ˈprɑː-] ESSENTIAL  ■a series of actions that you take in order to achieve a result 过程；步骤
•the peace process和平进程

•Increasing the number of women in top management jobs will be a slow process.增加高级管理职位女性的人数将是一个缓慢的过程。

•This decision may delay the process of European unification.这一决策可能会延后欧洲一体化的进程。

•The party has begun the painful (= difficult) process of rethinking its policies and strategy.该党开始了重新审视其政策和战略的艰难历程。

•Going to court to obtain compensation is a long process.起诉要求赔偿是一个漫长的过程。

•She arrived at the correct answer by a process of elimination (= by deciding against each answer that was unlikely to be correct until only one was left).她使用排除法找到了正确答案。
 ESSENTIAL  ■a series of changes that happen naturally 变化过程；进程
•the digestive process消化过程

•the ageing process衰老的过程

•It's all part of the learning process.这完全是学习过程的一部分。
 ADVANCED  ■a method of producing goods in a factory by treating raw materials 制作方法，加工方法
•They have developed a new process for extracting aluminium from bauxite.他们创造出一种从铁矾土中提炼铝的新方法。

noun countable UK [ˈprəʊ.ses] US [ˈprɑː-]be in the process of doing sth  ADVANCED  ■to have started doing something 在…的进程中
•We're still in the process of decorating the house.我们还在装修房子。

noun countable UK [ˈprəʊ.ses] US [ˈprɑː-]in the process ■If you are doing something, and you do something else in the process, the second thing happens as a result of doing the first thing 同时，在…的过程中
•I stood up to say hello and spilt my drink in the process.我站起来打招呼时把饮料弄翻了。

verb DEAL WITH  处理   ADVANCED  UK ['prəʊ.ses] US ['prɑ:-] transitive ■to deal with documents in an official way 处理；办理
•Visa applications take 28 days to process.办理签证申请需要28天的时间。
 ADVANCED  UK ['prəʊ.ses] US ['prɑ:-] transitive ■If a computer processes information, it performs a particular series of operations on the information, such as a set of calculations. （电脑）处理（资料） ADVANCED  UK ['prəʊ.ses] US ['prɑ:-] transitive ■to prepare, change or treat food or raw materials as a part of an industrial operation 加工（食品或原料）
•a waste processing plant废物处理厂
■UK ['prəʊ.ses] US ['prɑ:-] transitive ■to make pictures from photographic film 冲洗加工（底片）；印
•I need to get those films processed.我得把那些底片洗出来。

verb WALK  走  /prə'ses] intransitive + adverb or preposition formal ■to walk slowly 缓慢地走
•We watched them process down the aisle.我们看着他们沿着走廊慢慢走了过去。




vt. 处理；加工
 - manufacture, cope with
n. 过程，进行；方法，步骤；作用；程序；推移
 - going on, course, system, method, approach
examples: 英 ['prəʊsɛs] 美 ['prɑˌsɛs]
n.工序；过程v.加工；处理；起诉；列队前进

(1) Building a car is a long process.(2) Growth and decay are vital processes.(3) Brazil began importing soybeans to process at home.(4) The computer helps us to process reservation rapidly.(5) Orders are starting to backlog faster than we can process them.(6) The district attorney processed against the defaulting debtor.(7) The visitors processed into the house.(8) The bishops, priests and deacons processed into the cathedral.
(1) 制造一辆小汽车有很长的工序。(2) 生长和衰亡是生命过程。(3) 巴西开始进口大豆在国内加工。(4) 计算机帮助我们迅速处理预定。(5) 订单开始形成积压,我们来不及处理。(6) 地方检查官起诉不履行债务的债务人。(7) 参观者列队走进这房子里。(8) 主教、 司铎以及助祭列队走进大教堂。
[sound:youdao-2dacced8-88eb9900-1d02b304-0e63dcd7-f3a6a1e2.mp3]

translation:
n. 队伍，行列; 一列，一排; 列队行进
vi. 排队前进或列队而行

分布：队伍(74%)，行列(19%)，列队行进(7%)


→来自process,行进，进行。引申词义行伍，队伍。
n.队伍,行列During the procession, the microprocessor finished the processing procedure.在队伍行进时,微处理器完成了加工过程.



noun  ADVANCED  countable ■a line of people who are all walking or travelling in the same direction, especially in a formal way as part of a religious ceremony or public celebration 行列，队伍
•a wedding/funeral procession婚礼／葬礼的行列

•The festival will open with a procession led by the mayor.艺术节将由市长带领的一支队伍揭开序幕。
only singular ■a series of people or things, one after the other 一系列，一长串
•My day has just been a never-ending procession of visitors.我今天一整天来访的客人络绎不绝。





procession, parade, demonstration

这组词都有“游行”的意思，其区别是：
procession: 指举行庆祝活动或盛大仪式时庄严行进的有秩序的游行队伍或行列。
parade: 多指盛大和正式的游行，有检阅等活动。
demonstration: 侧重指抗议的示威性游行。


n. 队伍，行列；一列，一排；列队行进
 - train, cavalcade
vi. 列队行进
 - file
examples: 英 [prə'seʃn] 美 [prə'seʃn]
n.队伍；行列v.列队行进
(1) They watched the procession go past.(2) The royal procession will be televised.(3) The funeral procession choked up Lorna.(4) There was a bomb scare during the procession.
(1) 他们观看游行队伍经过。(2) 国王的仪仗行列将由电视播送。(3) 那送葬行列使洛娜流下了眼泪。(4) 在列队行进时因怀疑有炸弹而引起恐慌。
[sound:youdao-83947b97-7119bf78-a5f7bbb7-cc9fcdae-58bb8043.mp3]

translation:
vt. 宣告，公布; 表明; 赞扬，称颂

时态：proclaimed, proclaiming, proclaims
分布：表明(42%)，声明(37%)，赞扬(13%)，正式宣布(8%)


→pro-,向前，-claim,说，词源同claim,clamor.引申词义声称，声明。
公布;声明(pro在前＋claim→在前面喊→公布)[claim,clam=cyrout,shout,表示"呼喊,叫喊"]
v.宣告,声明The man proclaimed in exclamation that he aimed to reclaim the aimless claim.那个人呼喊着声明说他打算索回无目标的索赔.



US [proʊ-] verb transitive ANNOUNCE  宣布   ADVANCED  formal ■to announce something publicly or officially, especially something positive 宣布；声明
•All the countries have proclaimed their loyalty to the alliance.所有的国家都显示了它们对联盟的忠诚。

•Republican party members were confidently proclaiming victory even as the first few votes came in.才刚得到几张选票，共和党员就信心十足准备宣布胜利了。

•[+ that] It was the famous speech in which he proclaimed that socialism was dead.就是在那场著名的演讲中他宣称自己不会放弃。

•[+ two objects] She was proclaimed Queen at the age of thirteen after the sudden death of her father.父亲猝死后，她13岁就被立为女王。

UK [prəʊ'kleɪm] US [proʊ-] verb transitive SHOW  表示  literary■to show something or make it clear 表明；显示
•Wearing scarves and hats which proclaimed their allegiance, the football fans flooded into the bar.足球迷们戴着表示忠诚的头巾和帽子，如潮水般涌入酒吧。





allege, affirm, announce, proclaim, assert, claim

这组词都有“声称”的意思，其区别是：
allege: v.在无真凭实据的情况下宣称、断定。
 • The suspect alleged that he had not been in the neighborhood at the time of the crime.   嫌疑犯声称案发时他不在现场。
affirm: v.坚信不疑地肯定或宣称，是deny的反义词。
 • He affirmed his love for her.   他发誓爱她。
announce: v.宣布，宣告。多指首次当众正式宣布某一主张或态度，常常带有预告的意味。
 • The invention of the printing press announced the diffusion of knowledge.   印刷术的发明宣告了知识普及时代的来临。
proclaim: v.宣布；宣告(成立)。指经过深思熟虑后向大众宣布一个明确的决定或判断，尤其指重大事件的宣布，多用于官方场合。
 • The president proclaimed an emergency when the war came.   当战争来临的时候总统宣布进入紧急状态。
assert: v.指不管事实如何，主观自信地宣称，或者清楚有力地坚持某个情况为事实。
 • She asserted that she was innocent .   她宣称自己是无辜的。
claim: v.要求，声称，断言。多指根据某种规定提出的要求或主张。
 • They claim that if more people rode bicycles to go to work there would be fewer automobiles in the downtown section of the city.   他们生成如果有更多的人骑自行车上班的话，闹市区的汽车就会有所减少。



announce, declare, proclaim, pronounce, advertise, broadcast, publish

这些动词均含“宣布，公开”之意。
announce: 多指首次宣布大家感兴趣或可满足大家好奇心的事情。
declare: 侧重正式就某事清楚明白地宣布。
proclaim: 指官方宣布重大事件或施政方针，语体比announce正式。
pronounce: 词义与announce,  declare接近，但较多用于指法律判决方面的宣布。
advertise: 指通过文字和图像资料等的反复宣传而引起公众的注意，有时隐含令人不快或言过其实的意味。
broadcast: 专指利用广播或电视传播消息或发表见解。
publish: 专指通过报刊或其它媒介向公众公布事情。


vt. 宣告，公布；声明；表明；赞扬
 - indicate, sound, post, state, publish
examples: 英 [prə'kleɪm] 美 [prə'kleɪm]
vt.正式宣布；声明；表明；赞扬

(1) The president proclaimed that a new currency would be issued.(2) She did not proclaim her intention.(3) He was impelled to proclaim his doctrine.(4) His accent proclaimed that he was an American.(5) They will proclaim my glory among the nations.(6) Nations proclaim him their Lord and their saviour.
(1) 总统宣布将发行新货币。(2) 她没有把自己的意图明说出来。(3) 他不得不宣扬他的教义。(4) 他的口音表明他是一个美国人。(5) 他们必将我的荣耀传扬在列国中。(6) 各国称颂他为他们的主及救世主。
[sound:youdao-26afeb61-48877237-802e247d-ba2bb1cd-8f8b2e6a.mp3]

translation:
vt. & vi. 生产; 产生; 制作; 创作
vt. 制造; 出示; 引起; [经济学]生利
n. 产品; 产量; 产额; 结果

时态：produced, producing, produces
分布：生产(52%)，产品(28%)，农产品(12%)，引起(5%)，提出(2%)，制片(1%)


→pro-,向前，-duc,拉，引导，词源同conduce,conduct.引申词义生产，制造。
生产N.农产品(pro向前+duce→引向前→生产)[duc,duct=lead,bring,表示"引导,带来"]
v.生产,制造,显示,演出,导致n.产品The producer introduced a productive technological product into production.制造者把一项多产的技术成果引进到生产中.
【记】pro向前，duce引导－引导出的产品－农产品【参】productive（adj 多产的）；productivity（n 生产力）



US [-ˈduːs]MAKE  制造   ESSENTIAL  ■to make something or bring something into existence 生产；出产；制造
•France produces a great deal of wine for export.法国生产大量葡萄酒供出口。

•Red blood cells are produced in the bone marrow.红血球细胞在骨髓内生成。

•She works for a company that produces (= makes for sale) electrical goods.她在一家生产电子产品的公司工作。

•I was wondering whether I could produce a meal out of what's left in the fridge.我不知道能否用冰箱里剩的东西做一顿饭。

•She's asked me to produce a report on the state of the project.她要求我就这项工程的状况写一份报告。
■When animals produce young, they give birth to them 生，生育
•Our cat produced four kittens during the course of the night.我们的猫在夜里生了四只小猫。

•humorous All our friends seem to be busy producing offspring at the moment.我们所有的朋友现在似乎都忙着生儿育女。

verb transitive UK [prəˈdjuːs] US [-ˈduːs]CAUSE  引起   ADVANCED  ■to cause a reaction or result 引起；使产生
•The prime minister's speech produced an angry response from the opposition.首相的发言招致了反对派愤怒的抨击。

•Her remarks produced an awkward silence.她的讲话引起了一阵尴尬的沉默。

•If used on delicate skin, this cream may produce a stinging sensation.这种润肤霜用在娇嫩的皮肤上会产生刺痛感。

verb transitive UK [prəˈdjuːs] US [-ˈduːs]FILM/MUSIC  电影／音乐  ■to organize the practical and financial matters connected with the preparation of a film, play or television or radio programme 制作 Compare direct  to be in charge of making a musical recording and to be responsible for the arrangement of the music, the combination of the different instruments or voices and the general sound of it 制作（唱片）
verb transitive UK [prəˈdjuːs] US [-ˈduːs]BRING OUT  拿出  ■to bring something out from somewhere and show it 拿出；出示
•He produced a letter from his desk which he asked me to read.他从书桌里拿出一封信叫我读。

•One of the men suddenly produced a knife from his pocket.其中一名男子突然从口袋里掏出一把刀。

verb transitive UK [prəˈdjuːs] US [-ˈduːs]RESULT IN  导致  ■to result in or discover something, especially proof 引起，使产生
•A lengthy police investigation failed to produce any evidence on which the suspect could be convicted.警方的长期调查并未发现任何能证明嫌犯有罪的证据。

noun uncountable UK [ˈprɒd.juːs] US [ˈprɑː.djuːs/■food or any other substance or material that is grown or obtained through farming, especially that which is produced in large amounts （尤指大量生产的）食品，农产品
•agricultural/dairy/fresh produce农产品／乳制品／新鲜的农产品





invent, compose, make, create, design, produce

这组词都有“创造”的意思，其区别是：
invent: 主要用于科技领域，指通过思考、研究或实验制造出新的前所未有、极为有用的东西。
compose: 多指音乐或诗歌、画的创作。
make: 最普通用词，指任何东西的创作或制造。
create: 侧重创造出来的东西以前并不存在，或者指独具特色的创作。
design: 主要指在艺术或技术领域的创作设计，强调构思多于实际制造。
produce: 指产品的生产，或作品创作的完成。



manufacture, yield, contribute, create, produce

manufacture: （强调机器成批）生产
yield: 生出、产生或提供（自然产物、结果或利润等）
contribute: 贡献出
create: 引起，造成（感觉或印象）
produce: 制造，引起，导致，带来



realize, cause, effect, produce

这组词都有“产生、实现”的意思，其区别是：
realize: 着重指把过去的计划或意愿变成现实。
cause: 强调事物的因果关系。
effect: 侧重成功地完成一件要做的事情，强调结果或影响。
produce: 侧重有意或无意地产生出好的或坏的，实际可见的效果。



manufacture, fabricate, make, produce

这组词都有“做，制造”的意思，其区别是：
manufacture: 正式用词，一般指用机器大规模地批量生产各种生活或生产用品。
fabricate: 特指按照标准样式制作或把材料或部件组合成一个整体。
make: 普通用词，很常用，含义广，既可指制造具体的东西，也可指完成一种行为。
produce: 普通用词，侧重大量地生产出各种生产用品和生活用品。强调结果。也用于引申。



product, manufacture, production, produce

这组词都有“产品，制品”的意思，其区别是：
product: 一般指工业产品，也可泛指各种各样的产品。
manufacture: 一般指机器大量制造的产品。
production: 含义广泛，不同场合有不同的意思，可表示“产品，产物”，尤指人类智力或艺术劳动的产品。
produce: 多指农产品(尤指蔬菜水果等)。


vt. 生产；引起；创作
 - attract, cause, operate, occasion, induce
n. 农产品，产品
 - manufacture, work, agricultural products
vi. 生产，创作
 - turn out, bring in
examples: 英 [prə'djuːs] 美 [prə'duːs]
v.生产；引起；提出；制片；分娩n.产品；农产品

(1) This tree produces rubber.(2) The plain weave is comparatively inexpensive to produce.(3) His announcement produced gasps of amazement.(4) If you deny my statement, I can produce witness to prove its truth.(5) He hopes to find the money to produce a film about Japan.(6) Female sheep produce one or two lambs at a time.(7) This shop sells native produce.(8) Our chefs use only the freshest produce available.
(1) 这些树生产橡胶。(2) 相对来说,平纹组织的生产成本较低。(3) 他宣布的消息引起了一片惊叹声。(4) 如果你要否认我的陈述,我可以提出证据来证明其真实性。(5) 他希望筹集到资金以便拍一部关于日本的影片。(6) 母羊一次生一到两只羊羔。(7) 这家商店出售土特产品。(8) 我们的厨师只用现有最新鲜的农产品。
[sound:youdao-e3d41cce-e5b52149-02fb140b-df2bea4a-89de9542.mp3]

translation:
n. 产品; 结果; 乘积; 作品

分布：产品(87%)，产物(7%)，结果(3%)，乘积(2%)，某种影响下产生的人或物(1%)


→pro-,向前，-duct,拉，引导，词源同conduce,conduct.引申词义生产，产品，制品。
产物,产品(pro+duct→引出的东西→产品)[duc,duct=lead,bring,表示"引导,带来"]
n.产品,产物;乘积The producer introduced a productive technological product into production.制造者把一项多产的技术成果引进到生产中.



US ['prɑ:.dʌkt] noun THING MADE  产品   ESSENTIAL  countable or uncountable ■something that is made to be sold, usually something that is produced by an industrial process or, less commonly, something that is grown or obtained through farming 产品；产物
•They do a range of skin-care products.他们生产一系列的护肤品。

•The product is so good it sells itself.这种产品非常好，不需要促销。

•I'm trying to cut down on dairy products.我正设法减少乳制品的食用量。
⇒ See also by-producta/the product of sth ■a/the result of something …的结果
•A figure like that is usually the product of many hours spent in the gym.那样的体形通常是在健身房花了很长时间锻炼的结果。

•She had a very happy childhood, and I guess her confidence is a product of that.她的童年非常幸福，我想正是那段时光培养了她的自信。

UK ['prɒd.ʌkt] US ['prɑ:.dʌkt] noun MATHEMATICS  数学  countable specialized ■the result you get when two or more numbers are multiplied together （乘）积
•The product of six and three is eighteen.6乘3的积为18。





product, manufacture, production, produce

这组词都有“产品，制品”的意思，其区别是：
product: 一般指工业产品，也可泛指各种各样的产品。
manufacture: 一般指机器大量制造的产品。
production: 含义广泛，不同场合有不同的意思，可表示“产品，产物”，尤指人类智力或艺术劳动的产品。
produce: 多指农产品(尤指蔬菜水果等)。


n. [经] 产品；结果； [数] 乘积；作品
 - outcome, event, result, manufacture, writing
examples: 英 ['prɒdʌkt] 美 ['prɑːdʌkt]
n.产品；产物；结果；某种影响下产生的人或物；乘积

(1) If our product is properly marketed, it shall sell very well.(2) The eastern frontier of France was the product of centuries of historical accidents.(3) They are the products of post-war affluence.(4) The product of 21 and 16 is 336.
(1) 如果我们的产品适当加以推销,销路应该很好。(2) 法国东部的边境是百年来历史上风云变幻的结果。(3) 他们是战後富裕生活的产儿。(4) 21和16的乘积是336。
[sound:youdao-6f4f039a-7d7ecb95-e2edc8cf-8d878759-889e78c8.mp3]

translation:
n. 生产，制作; 产品; 产量; 夸张的行动或形象，小题大做

分布：生产(85%)，产量(9%)，制作(3%)，作品(1%)，成果(1%)，分泌(1%)


→来自product,生产，产品。
n.生产,产品,作品,(研究)成果,总产量The producer introduced a productive technological product into production.制造者把一项多产的技术成果引进到生产中.



noun MAKING  生产   ESSENTIAL  uncountable ■the process of making or growing goods to be sold 生产；制造
•Coke is used in the production of steel.焦炭用于炼钢。

•We saw a quick film showing the various stages in the production of glass.我们看了一部短片，片中展示玻璃制造过程中的不同阶段。

•The company's new model will be going into production early next year.这家公司的新型号将于明年初开始生产。
 ADVANCED  uncountable ■the amount of something that is made or grown by a country or a company 产量
•Swedish industrial production has fallen steadily this year.瑞典的工业产量今年逐步下降。

•Wheat production has risen over the years.小麦产量在这几年内提高了。

[prə'dʌk.ʃən] noun FILM/MUSIC  电影／音乐   ADVANCED  countable or uncountable ■the activity of organizing the practical and financial matters connected with the preparation of a film, play or television or radio programme 制作，制片
•She's hoping to get into television production.她希望参与电视节目制作。

•Disney's latest production (= film) looks likely to be their most successful ever.迪士尼最新推出的这部电影看来很有可能是他们最成功的一部。
countable ■a particular series of performances of a theatrical entertainment such as a play or opera 上演；上映
•They're doing a new production of Macbeth at the National Theatre.他们正在国家剧院上演新编排的《马克白》。
uncountable ■the preparation and general quality of a musical recording's sound, showing the way in which the music was recorded rather than the quality of the singing and the music （录音）制作，监制
•George Martin did the production on the Beatles records.乔治‧马丁制作了披头四乐团的唱片。

[prə'dʌk.ʃən] noun BRINGING OUT  拿出  uncountable formal ■the act of taking something out and showing it 拿出；出示
•Entry to the club is only permitted on production (= the showing) of a membership card.进入俱乐部须出示会员卡。

[prə'dʌk.ʃən] noun make a production (out) of sth ■to make something seem more difficult or complicated to do than it is 夸张，不必要地复杂化；小题大做
•If you ask Tom to do anything, he always makes such a production of it that you wish you'd just done it yourself.如果你叫汤姆做事，他总是搞得小题大做，最终你会想如果是自己做了还好些。





product, manufacture, production, produce

这组词都有“产品，制品”的意思，其区别是：
product: 一般指工业产品，也可泛指各种各样的产品。
manufacture: 一般指机器大量制造的产品。
production: 含义广泛，不同场合有不同的意思，可表示“产品，产物”，尤指人类智力或艺术劳动的产品。
produce: 多指农产品(尤指蔬菜水果等)。


n. 成果；产品； [经] 生产；作品
 - feedback, outcome, writing, manufacture, work
examples: 英 [prə'dʌkʃn] 美 [prə'dʌkʃn]
n.生产；产量；作品；成果；分泌；制作；上映；播出

(1) We must increase production levels.(2) The necessary outcome of a war is a fall in production.(3) If we cannot sell more goods, we'll have to cut back on the production.(4) This book on education is his latest production.(5) Chapter five is the conclusion .In this part , research production is summarized.(6) The company entered into motion picture production in1897.
(1) 我们必须提高生产水平。(2) 战争带来的必然结果就是生产力下降。(3) 如果我们不能卖出更多的货物,就必须降低产量。(4) 这本论述教育的书是他的最新作品。(5) 第五章是文章的结论部分，主要对前面的研究成果进行了总结。(6) 这个公司在1897年就开始电影制作工作了。

translation:
adj. 富有成效的; 多产的; 生产性的; 具有创造性的

分布：有成效的(43%)，多产的(37%)，生产的(20%)


→来自product,生产，产品。
生产的;多产的(product+ive)[duc,duct=lead,bring,表示"引导,带来"]
a.生产(性)的,能产的,多产的The producer introduced a productive technological product into production.制造者把一项多产的技术成果引进到生产中.



adjective  IMPROVER  ■resulting in or providing a large amount or supply of something 多产的，富饶的
•In order to turn the deserts into fertile and productive land, engineers built an 800-mile canal.为了把沙漠变成肥沃富饶的农田，工程师们修建了一条800英哩长的运河。

•He had an amazingly productive five years in which he managed to write four novels.五年内他写了四部小说，如此多产真让人难以置信。
 Opposite unproductive  IMPROVER  ■having positive results 富有成效的
•We had a very productive meeting - I felt we sorted out a lot of problems.我们开了一个极有成效的会议——我觉得我们解决了很多问题。

•Theirs was a very productive partnership.他们之间的合作很有成效。




adj. 能生产的；生产的，生产性的；多产的；富有成效的
 - fruitful, procreative
examples: 英 [prə'dʌktɪv] 美 [prə'dʌktɪv]
adj.生产的；有成效的；多产的

(1) Their productive cycle covers several decades.(2) Our productive task is making the machine.(3) They work hard, but their efforts are not very productive.(4) I spent a very productive hour in the library.(5) He is a productive writer, creating many great works in his life.(6) Once the plants have produced fruit, they become less productive.
(1) 它们的生产周期可延续几十年。(2) 我们的生产任务是造机器。(3) 他们很努力，但效率不太高。(4) 我在图书馆里的这一小时收获很大。(5) 他是一个多产的作家，他一生创作了许多作品。(6) 一旦收获了果实，草莓作物就变得少产了。
[sound:youdao-ce0799d0-3c3585c8-c5258e7e-72fe2a2d-13acf072.mp3]

translation:
n. 职业，专业; 同行; 宣称; 信念，信仰

分布：职业(69%)，行业(25%)，声明(4%)，信仰(2%)


→来自profess,宣称，信奉，-ion,名词后缀。引申词义职业，行业，即内心的召唤。词义演变比较vocation,voice.
职业(pro在前面+fess+ion→在前面说话→进入[律师,教师等]职业;参考：professor)[fess=speak,表示"说"]
n.职业,专业,表白,宣布He is a salesman by profession.他的职业是推销员.



noun WORK  工作   IMPROVER  countable [+ sing/pl verb] ■any type of work which needs special training or a particular skill, often one which is respected because it involves a high level of education （尤指需要特殊训练或专业技能的）职业
•He left the teaching profession in 1965 to set up his own business.他1965年离开教师岗位自己创业。

•The report notes that forty per cent of lawyers entering the profession are women.这份报告指出，执业律师中有40%是女性。

•Teaching as a profession is very underpaid.教书作为一种职业，酬劳其实过低。

•He's a doctor by profession.他的职业是医生。
 ADVANCED  countable [+ sing/pl verb] ■the people who do a type of work, considered as a group 某职业的全体人员；同行，同业
•There's a feeling among the nursing profession that their work is undervalued.在护理人员之间存在一种看法——认为他们的工作未得到应有的重视。
the professions ■jobs which need special training and skill, such as being a doctor or lawyer, but not work in business or industry （医生或律师等需特殊训练或技能的）职业
[prə'feʃ.ən] noun STATEMENT  表示  countable ■a statement about what someone feels, believes or intends to do, often made publicly 表示，表白
•The government's professions of commitment to the environment seem less believable every day.政府支持环保的表态似乎一天比一天不可信。

•his professions of love他的爱情表白





assignment, task, profession, job

assignment: 指分派做的特定任务，也指长期性工作
task: 被派或自愿承担工作，尤指困难、辛劳的工作
profession: 指从事脑力劳动，经过特殊培训的“职业”，如老师
job: 常指短期任务



work, vocation, occupation, employment, trade, profession, career, job

这组词都有“职业”的意思，其区别是：
work: 指任何种类的工作，也泛指职业。
vocation: 较正式用词，语气庄重，指长期从事，但不一定以此为主计的职业。
occupation: 泛指任何一种职业，既不分什么行业，也不管是脑力还是体力劳动。
employment: 指受雇于他人，领取工资以谋生计，有较固定工作的职业。
trade: 指需要有熟练技巧、技能和体力的职业。
profession: 以前常指要受过高等教育(尤指法律、医学和神学)才能获得的职业，现在一般指为谋生日的职业，尤指从事脑力劳动和受过专门训练，具有某种专业知识的职业。
career: 指经过专门训练，终身愿意从事的职业。
job: 通常指一切有收入，不分脑力与体力运动，不论是否有技艺的长期或临时的职业。


n. 职业，专业；声明，宣布，表白
 - employment, career, calling, pursuit, statement, occupation
examples: 英 [prə'feʃn] 美 [prə'feʃn]
n.职业；声明；行业；信仰

(1) Nursing is a vocation as well as a profession.(2) I don't believe her profession of friendship for us.(3) He is a leading member of the medical profession.(4) The legal profession has always resisted change.(5) That's why our profession of faith is hollow if we are not caring for our own family.
(1) 护理工作既是职业又是救死扶伤的责任。(2) 我不相信她声称同我们友好。(3) 他是医疗业中首屈一指的医生。(4) 法律界人士对变革总是加以抵制。(5) 那就是说明了，如果我们不眷顾我们家里的人，我们的信仰告白就是空的。

translation:
n. 教授; （大学的）讲师，教员; 自称者，宣称者

分布：教授(98%)，老师(2%)


→来自profess,宣称，信奉，-er,人。字面意思指公开宣称自己在某领域是行家的人，经得起挑战和质问的人。后用于教师职业的尊称。
教授(pro在前面+fess说+or人→在前面说话的人→教授)[fess=speak,表示"说"]
n.教授The chess professor confessed his professional blessing in the confession.象棋教授在供状中承认了其职业福气.



US [-ɚ] noun countable  IMPROVER  ■a teacher of the highest rank in a department of a British university, or a teacher of high rank in an American university or college 教授
•Professor Stephen Hawking斯蒂芬•霍金教授

•a professor of sociology社会学教授

•a sociology professor社会学教授




n. 教授；教师；公开表示信仰的人
 - teacher, master
examples: 英 [prə'fesə(r)] 美 [prə'fesər]
n.教授；老师

(1) Our professor is a man of profound learning.(2) The professor invited his students to his home for conversation.(3) Professor Green, lately of Princeton, is now head of the department at California.(4) I'd like you to meet my geography professor.
(1) 我们的教授是一个学识渊博的人。(2) 教授邀请学生们到自己家里会晤。(3) 格林教授不久前在普林斯顿任教，现在是加州大学的系主任。(4) 我想介绍我的地理老师给你认识。
[sound:youdao-b3e36c79-37aae699-e2640f52-66da9627-e4dbecd7.mp3]

translation:
n. 收益，得益; 利润; 红利; 净值利润率
vt. 有益于…，对…有益的; 得益; 创利润
vi. 有益; 获利

时态：profited, profiting, profits
分布：利润(68%)，获利(11%)，利益(9%)，得益(6%)，收益(4%)，有益于(2%)


→pro-,向前，-fit,做，词源同benefit,effect.字母c脱落。即做事的收益，引申词义利润，报酬。
利润,收益(pro+fit做→做很多→做得好→利润)[pro-①表示"向前,在前"②表示"很多…"③表示"赞同,亲..."]
利润;利益(pro前+fit[=fict]→先做的好处→利益)[fac,fact,fect,fic,fig=make,do,表示"做,制作"]
n.利润,收益v.(by,from)得利,获益;有利于The situation is fit for profiting and beneficial to the shops situated nearby.这种形势适于获利且对坐落在附近的商铺有益.



US ['prɑ:.fɪt] noun  ESSENTIAL  countable or uncountable ■money which is earned in trade or business, especially after paying the costs of producing and selling goods and services 利润，盈利
•She makes a big profit from selling waste material to textile companies.她将废弃材料卖给纺织公司，从中赚取大笔利润。

•A year ago the Tokyo company had a pretax profit of 35 million yen.一年前，东京公司的税前利润是3500万日元。

•Company profits are down on last year's figures.从去年的统计数字看，公司的利润下降了。

•You don't expect to make much profit within the first couple of years of setting up a company.你不要指望在创立公司的头几年里会赚取很多利润。

•He sold his house at a huge profit.他卖掉自己的房子，赚了很多钱。
uncountable ■the good or advantage that can be achieved by a particular action or activity 好处，益处
•There's no profit to be gained from endlessly discussing whose fault it was.没完没了地讨论谁是谁非是徒劳无益的。

UK ['prɒf.ɪt] US ['prɑ:.fɪt] noun   Common Learner Errors   profitWarning:  Choose the right verb!Don't say 'get a profit', say make a profit :✗ The company will get a big profit from this investment.The company will make a big profit from this investment.
UK ['prɒf.ɪt] US ['prɑ:.fɪt] verb   Phrasal Verbs   profit from sth ■to earn money from something 从…赚钱；从…获利
•A lot of companies will profit from the fall in interest rates.利率降低，许多公司将从中获利。
■to achieve an advantage from something 得益
•I profited enormously from working with her.和她一起工作，我获益匪浅。





profit, benefit, avail

这组词都有“有益于，有益”的意思，其区别是：
profit: 着重于物质方面的受益，常用于财富或知识等方面的得益。
benefit: 通常既可指个人情况(如身体、智力或精神状态等)的好转或改善，又可指对实现某个目标等带来的好处。
avail: 较文雅，常见于历史小说、演说或讲道中，较少用于日常话语，侧重功效或效力。



profit, advantage, benefit, interest, favour, gain

这组词都有“利益、好处”的意思，其区别是：
profit: 着重收益，尤指从物质、钱财等方面获得的利益。
advantage: 指因某方面占优势或利用某机会以及对方弱点而获得利益与好处。
benefit: 普通用词，指通过正当手段从物质或精神方面得到的任何好处或利益。
interest: 作“利益”解时，多用复数形式，既可指集团、群体的利益，又可指个人的利益。
favour: 指在竞争中获得的advantage,也可指在狭隘的个人利益。
gain: 指获得的物质利益，也暗示不损坏他人利益而得的无形好处。


n. [会计] 利润；利益
 - behalf, margin, benefit, gain, sake
vi. 获利；有益
 - advantage, gain
vt. 有益于
 - benefit, be good for
examples: 英 ['prɒfɪt] 美 ['prɑːfɪt]
n.利润；收益；利益vi.得益；获利vt.有益于

(1) There is very little profit in selling newspapers at present.(2) I want to know the net profit.(3) It is well known that fake and inferior commodities do harm to the profit of consumers.(4) We profit from the work of the specialist.(5) He learned to profit by his mistakes.(6) Knowing what you know and profit from it.(7) All his wealth did not profit him.
(1) 现在卖报纸利润很少。(2) 我想知道净收益。(3) 众所周知,假冒伪劣商品损害了消费者的利益。(4) 我们从专家的工作中得到益处。(5) 他学会了从自己的错误中获益。(6) 知道自己知道什么,并从中获利。(7) 他所有的财富于他无益。
[sound:youdao-9f44e67c-62d08757-5159db3b-1c790d72-01eeff2b.mp3]

translation:
n. 进步; 前进; [生物学]进化; （向更高方向）增长
v. （使）进步，（使）进行; 发展; 促进
vi. 发展; （向更高方向）增进

时态：progressed, progressing, progresses
分布：进步(65%)，发展(20%)，前进(11%)，促进(3%)，缓速前进(1%)


→来自pro-,向前，朝向，-gress,走，词源同grade,aggressive.
进步(pro+gress走→向前走)[pro-①表示"向前,在前"②表示"很多…"③表示"赞同,亲..."]
进步;进行(pro向前+gress→向前走→前进)[gress=go,walk表示"行走"]
v./n.进步,进展;前进We are glad he has made such great progress.我们很高兴,他取得了这样大的进步.



US [ˈprɑː-] ESSENTIAL  ■movement to an improved or more developed state, or to a forward position 进步，进展
•Technological progress has been so rapid over the last few years.在最近几年中，科技进步如此迅猛。

•I'm not making much progress with my Spanish.我的西班牙语没多大进步。

•The doctor said that she was making good progress (= getting better after a medical operation or illness).医生说她的情况正在好转。

•The recent free elections mark the next step in the country's progress towards democracy.最近的自由选举显示该国又朝民主迈进了一步。

•The yacht's crew said that they were making relatively slow progress north-easterly.游艇上的船员说他们正以较为缓慢的速度向东北方向前进。
in progress  ADVANCED  formal ■happening or being done now 正在进行中
•Repair work is in progress on the south-bound lane of the motorway and will continue until June.高速公路南下的车道正在维修，六月份才会完工。

verb intransitive /prəˈgres/ ADVANCED  ■to improve or develop in skills, knowledge, etc 进步；改进；进展
•My Spanish never really progressed beyond the stage of being able to order drinks at the bar.我的西班牙语一点也没提升，真的，也就是只能在酒吧点饮料用用而已。
 Compare regress  ADVANCED  ■to continue gradually 缓慢进行
•As the war progressed more and more countries became involved.随着战争的推进，越来越多的国家卷入其中。

•We started off talking about the weather and gradually the conversation progressed to politics.我们从谈论天气开始，话题逐渐转向政治。





advance, progress, proceed, move on, go

这些动词均含“前进，行进，进展”之意。
advance: 主要用于具体的人或物，也可指科学技术和运动等。
progress: 指按某一既定目标前进，取得发展，目的性很明确，强调经常和稳定地前进。
proceed: 侧重指继续前进。
move on: 非正式用语，侧重从某一停止点向某地前进，但不表示前进的目的地。
go: 最常用词，含义宽泛而不确切，依上文确定其具体意思。


n. 进步，发展；前进
 - development, growth, making, advancement
vi. 前进，进步；进行
 - wage, do, go ahead
examples: 英 ['prəʊɡres] 美 ['prɑːɡres]
n.进步；发展；前进v.进步；发展；缓速前进；促进

(1) The student is showing rapid progress in his studies.(2) Physics has made enormous progress in this century.(3) They made slow progress towards the mountaintop.(4) He continues to progress in his studies.(5) Our company cannot progress until we employ more people.(6) They progressed along dark stone corridors.(7) We are meeting again tomorrow to try and progress the matter.
(1) 这个学生学习上进步很快。(2) 本世纪物理学的发展突飞猛进。(3) 他们向山顶缓慢地前进。(4) 他的学业继续取得进步。(5) 我们公司只有雇用更多的人才能发展。(6) 他们沿着黑暗的石廊缓慢前进。(7) 我们打算明天再见面，试着推动这件事情的发展。
[sound:youdao-7c77bec9-13619fe0-69e18992-8a705447-6bffca25.mp3]

translation:
adj. 不断前进的; 进步的; 进行的
n. 改革论者; 进步分子

分布：渐进的(42%)，先进的(27%)，进步分子(15%)，革新主义者(10%)，前进的(6%)


→来自progress,前进，进步。
进步的(progress+ive)[gress=go,walk表示"行走"]
a.进步的,先进的;前进的The progressive congressman dressed in black stressed his distress.穿着黑色衣服的进步国会议员强调了他的不幸.



adjective GRADUAL  逐渐的   ADVANCED  ■developing or happening gradually 逐渐的；渐进的
•There's been a progressive decline in the standard of living over the past few years.最近几年的生活水准每况愈下。

•a progressive disease慢性病

[prə'gres.ɪv] adjective MODERN  先进的   ADVANCED  ■describes ideas or systems which are new and modern, encouraging change in society or in the way that things are done （指思想或体制）进步的，先进的
•progressive ideas/attitudes进步的思想

•The left of the party is pressing for a more progressive social policy.该政党的左派人士敦促实行更加进步的社会政策。

•a progressive school实行渐进式教学的学校

[prə'gres.ɪv] adjective TAX  税  ■describes a tax system in which the rate of tax is higher on larger amounts of money 累进（税）的
[prə'gres.ɪv] adjective GRAMMAR  文法  ■describes the form of a verb which is used to show that the action is continuing. It is formed with the verb 'be' followed by the present participle -ing form of the verb （动词）进行式的
•'He's working hard at the moment' is an example of the present progressive form of the verb 'work'.He's working hard at the moment 是动词 work 的现在进行式的一个例子。

•'I was eating when the phone rang' is an example of the past progressive.I was eating when the phone rang 是过去进行式的一个例子。

[prə'gres.ɪv] noun countable ■a person who supports new ideas and social change, especially one who belongs to a political party 支持进步政策者；改革派人士 Compare reactionary



adj. [数] 进步的；先进的
 - advanced, ascensive
